Con las ganancias pudo obtener algunos beneficios para ayudar a la casta familiar, el continua dedicándose a la agricultura y le va muy bien entonces desea continuar en el banco comunal “Santa Ana” y por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, él es una persona responsable que va cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Leonardo is grateful for the loan. He did very well and had no problem paying off his loan. With the profits, he could get some benefits to fulfill the family's basic needs. He continues to dedicate himself to agriculture and is doing very well. He wants to continue with the communal bank "Santa Ana" but, at this time, he needs a loan to buy seeds. He is a responsible person who will comply with the payment of his monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 31 years old and lives in the town of Lira in Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two currently in school. 

For the past five years, Jacqueline has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household needs. 

To help expand her business, Jacqueline has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential home products for her shop.  It will help Jacqueline to generate greater profits and take good care of her children. 

Jacqueline hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital. 

Jacqueline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jacqueline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential home products for her shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old and lives in the town of Lira in Uganda. She is married and has five children, with three currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells all types of agricultural products. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more types of agricultural products to sale, and it will help Jane to generate greater profits and more stock for her business. 

Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to provide cilients with what they require. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more agricultural products to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 50 years old and lives in the town of Lira, Uganda. She is married and has five children, three currently in school. For the past 10 years, Anna has been working hard to manage her restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Anna has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy products that will be used for the restaurant and will help Anna to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Anna hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger restaurant. 

Anna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anna who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy products that will be used for the restaurant.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura sobre todo el cultivo de mangos, palta entre otros, comercio y ganadería, este distrito se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de mano de obra no califica en las fincas de sus vecinos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas de trabajo para poder seguir brinda este servicio, y una segunda parte para cambiar el techo de su casa comprando calamina y protegerse de las lluvias que se aproximan en los siguientes meses.
texts.en:
Oscar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Morropon district.  The people there are farmers and raise mangos and livestock.  This district is known for its carob tree forests and is located two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.
 
He does general labor on his neighbors’ farms and he is asking for a loan of 1,000 Soles to buy tools for his work and also replace the roof on his house to protect himself from the rain in the coming months.

loans.use: to buy tools and fix his roof.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail shop where she sells drinks. She describes her family challenge to be lack of access to reliable source of cooking. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy a gas cooker to enable her family to cook efficiently. She hopes that in the future, she will have a strong and reliable business.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 33-year-old business woman. She is single and has two children, ages five and eight years old. In 2007, she established her drinks and provisions business. When she dropped out of school, she started up a business to help her provide for her children's livelihood. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase more drinks and provisions. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 500,000. From the proceeds of the business, she will be able to admit her children in one of the recognized private schools, hoping that they get quality education so that they can take care of her in future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and provisions.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta 3 grado, está casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado 3 hijas de 35, 20 y 28 años de edad, viven en el extranjero, de él dependen sus 2 nietos.

Él se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 40años y a la agricultura, por medio de su papá aprendió este oficio; ya que su papá es agricultor. También, sus nietos se involucran con él su horario es de 7 a12.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para su esposa que se encuentra enferma y la otra parte para comprar una novilla.  

Su deseo es, que su esposa se mejore y tenga una mejor condición de vida en su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Miguel, 60, studied to the third grade. He is married and his wife is engaged in household chores. Miguel has fathered three daughters aged 35, 20, and 28 years, living abroad. His two grandchildren depend on him.

He has raised cattle and worked in agriculture for the last 40 years. He learned this craft from his father because he was also a farmer. Also, his grandchildren work with him on his 7 to 12 schedule.

The loan he is requesting is partly for his sick wife and also to buy a heifer. 
He desires to get his wife better and to have a better life personally and in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer and to care for his sick wife.

loans.name: José Leonardo

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad, es acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, 2 de sus hijos viven con él,  los demás ya están casados, también con él viven sus nietos.

José se dedica a la agricultura, desde que tenía 10 años, el trabajo lo aprendió por medio de su padre; se decidió por este trabajo ya que su padre lo inculco desde pequeño, también es jornalero, su trabajo queda a media hora de su casa, viaja a pie, con él se involucra un hijo el cual le ayuda en los cultivos

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos novillas para engordarlas y desarrollarlas productivamente, mejora su condición de vida ya que tendrá mejores ingresos a futuro.  

Su deseo es, que las dos novillas que compre, tengan un buen desarrollo y que a un futuro tengan una fuente de ingresos  para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José, 59, lives with his wife who is engaged in domestic chores. He has two children who live with him as the others are already married. He also has grandchildren living with him.

José has been making his living from agriculture since he was 10 years old. He learned how to do this work through his father instilling it in him since his childhood. José also is a day laborer. His work is a half an hour from home. He travels on foot with his son who helps him in the fields.

The loan he is requesting is to buy two heifers to fatten and raise them productively. He wants to improve his living conditions and have more income in the future. 

He hopes that the two heifers he buys will develop well and that he will have a future source of income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers to fatten and raise.

loans.name: Kamataris Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Annet is a widow, age 32 years, and from Biharwe, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school and got married when she was young. At the age of 30 with 3 children, her husband passed away, leaving her with no source of income to support the family.

She acquired a loan of 800,000 and started fruit vending in the market in order to survive and cater to the needs of her children. This business grew and helped her sustain her family. 

Her business progressed with the help of Ugafode microfinance loans, and this motivated her to mobilize her colleagues in the market to form a development group called Kamataris Twimukye group. This group has made their businesses prosper, and they are requesting a loan of 2,400,000 UGX to help them increase their business working capital to improve their standards of living. She will use the loan to book more fruits and vegetables from farmers such that she will have a constant supply.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ludovic

texts.en: Ludovic is a Cameroonian, aged 37 and married, with seven children. The oldest is 19 and in high school, while the youngest is 2 and in nursery school. Ludovic has been in this business for the past four years, which makes her very stable and experienced. This loan will increase her turnover from 750,000 to 950,000 XAF. Her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy raw food to cook and sell

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en: Jemimah lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is 28 years old and a mother of one. She sells vegetables at the village market and she has been doing this business for the last five years. She started the business from saving a thousand shillings. She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy vegetables to sell in her business. She has goals in life to buy a plot and own property of her own. The major challenges that she faces in the business are price fluctuations and inflation rates that affect her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Nyakariro Bishemwe Tukore Group

texts.en:
Nyakariro Group is a new group located in rural Ntungamo district in western Uganda. It's comprised of men and women whose major activity is farming, though a few are engaged in retail shops. 

They applied for loan of UGX 3,500,000, which they will divide within themselves.  They have a challenge of low production within their farming businesses,  due to poor farming methods and price fluctuation. Their prime target is to yield a high output from their plantations; also to take their children to good schools. But they are limited by capital and funds to enable them achieve their dreams.  

Ednansi will particularly use her loan to buy fertilizer to improve her soil fertility and her yields in the long run, which will also increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for higher yields

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, 35, is a vigorous, married woman and the mother of seven children. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past six years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. Balqees dreams for her children's bright future and wishes to spend the part of profit on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en:
Zaitoon, 28, is a vigorous married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a laborer but his income is not enough to support his family well. Zaitoon’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of four children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 26 years old, married and has a child, age 2. His family lives at Masazir village of Abseron region.
Hasan’s wife takes care of the baby and doesn’t work in a job outside the home.
Hasan is an electrician. His equipment is broken and for the time being he is unable to work. He applied for a loan in the amount of 1150 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for the term of 12 months. With this loan he will repair his equipment and will resume his work.
He is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for the aid. Hasan wants to hire a few assistants in the future.

loans.use: he will repair his electrician equipment

loans.name: Perpétua

texts.pt:
Perpétua  tem 37 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 03 filhos dos quais d0is maiores de idad todos  frequentando Escolas públicas. A sua base de sustento é o negócio, ela trabalha das 08h até as 20h todos os dias vendendo pipocas.
Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar uma máquina de fazer pipocas para poder  aumentar a produção e consequentemente as suas receitas.
O seu maior sonho é se tornar uma empresária no ramo dos  transportes porém, ela tem o desafio de acumular poupanças para conseguir comprar a primeira viatura.
texts.en:
Perpétua is 37 years old, divorced and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are of age and all of whom go to state Schools. Her income comes from her business: she works from 08h00 to 20h00 every day selling popcorn.

She will use the loan to buy a popcorn machine to be able to increase the quantity of her production and consequently her income.
Her biggest dream is to become a businesswoman in the transport industry, however her challenge is to amass enough savings to be able to buy her first vehicle.

loans.use: buy a popcorn machine to be able to increase the quantity of her production

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt:
Paulina tem 36 anos de idade, solteira e mãe  de 01 filha .A sua base de rendimento é o negócio. Ela trabalha todos os dias vendendo eletrodomésticos na sua casa e tambem por encomendas. Viaja mensalmente duas ou mais vezes para  comprar produtos na Africa do Sul.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  cadeiras e panelas  para revender em sua casa.
O seu maior sonho é de construir uma loja de forma a fazer o seu negócio num lugar fixo  e com boas condições.
 Seu desafio é de pagar o seu empréstimo dentro do periodo pré-estabelecido de forma a pedir outro, Bem como pagar a escola da sua filha.
texts.en:
Paulina is 36 years old, single and the mother of 1 daughter. Her income comes from her business. She works every day selling white goods from her home and also by mail order. She travels every month, usually two or more times to buy products from South Africa.

With this loan she plans to buy chairs and pots to resell from her home.

Her biggest dream is to build a shop so that she can run her business from a fixed location with good conditions.

Her challenge is to pay back her loan within the pre-agreed term so that she can ask for another one as well as paying for her daughter's school fees.

loans.use: buy chairs and pots to resell from her home.

loans.name: Simón Antonio

texts.es: Simón, es un humilde señor que tiene a su cargo el negocio familiar que consiste en la compra y venta de leña y cerdo en pie, que vende por libra en su casa y la leña la vende por encargo a domicilio, siendo su medio de transporte un carretón. Con sus hijos y esposa se dedican a este negocio, lo cual es el único sustento para su familia. Don Simón solicita el crédito para comprar más cerdos y leña para poder comercializarlos y mejorar las ventas, las cuales a veces están bajas, pero tiene la fe en que en estas fechas festivas sean  de mucha productividad.
texts.en: Simón is a humble man who is responsible for the family business that involves buying and selling firewood that he delivers to his customers' homes on a cart and live pigs that he sells by the pound in his home. He works in this business with his wife and children which is the sole source of income in the family. Don Simón is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and firewood to market and improve sales which are sometimes low but he has faith that in these festive days he will be very productive.

loans.use: to purchase live pigs and firewood.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is a widow and has one child. For the past three years, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells home products. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the business, and will help Mary generate greater profits and Increase family income. Mary hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan continua con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más, él sigue teniendo el puesto de venta donde vende sus productos a vecinos, amigos, familiares y además personas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, tarros de leche, pan pues para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Juan continues to sell household staples such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil and others from his sales stall. He sells to neighbors, friends, relatives and others.

Juan is requesting this loan to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles and containers of milk to increase the capital of his business. He says he appreciates and is grateful for the loan and that he promises to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles and containers of milk.

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es: Don José es originario de la ciudad de León, casado y padre de seis hijos, los cuales uno de ellos aún está a su cargo. Tiene 60 años de edad. Es de oficio mecánico, se dedica al taller de mecánica automotriz. Este negocio lo inicio hace muchos años, el cual le ha generado ingresos para garantizarle educación a su hijo. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio de servicios amplios para sus clientes. Solicita un crédito para comprar equipos y productos como: amortiguadores, aceite, lubricantes, entre otros con el fin de garantizar un servicio de calidad. Estima que este crédito ayudara a crecer su negocio y a obtener mejores ganancias, sobre todo garantizarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Su plan futuro es mejorar cada día mas su negocio y ofertando mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Jose is a native of the city of Leon.  He is married and is the father of 6 children, one of whom is still in his care.  Jose is 60 years old.  He is a mechanic who has an automotive workshop.  He started this business many years ago, and with it he generates the income he needs to pay for his child's education.  At this time, he has a business that offers a variety of services to his customers.  

Jose is requesting a loan to buy equipment and products such as: shock absorbers, motor oil, lubricants, and other items, so that he can provide good quality service.  He thinks that this loan will help him to grow his business, generate greater earnings, and most importantly, ensure better living conditions for his family.  His plan for the future is to improve his business every day, offering better services.

loans.use: to buy shocks, motor oil, lubricants, and other items

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Vanadzor town with his wife and three little children. He has worked as a taxi driver for 5 years already, running his own car. Artur's wife isn't working outside the home, as she has to take care of the household and children, so the only breadwinner in the family is Artur. As a very hard-working  man, Artur does his best to gather a good income and provide normal living conditions for his family. 

Artur is requesting this loan to renovate his car and continue his taxi driving business. Artur has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Artur to be able to continue driving a taxi and ensure a better life for his three children.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his taxi

loans.name: Zedekiah

texts.en: Zedekiah is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as a focused person. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle to earn a living. He describes his family challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will economically and socially sustain his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Evelyn Larissa

texts.es:
Evelyn de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es casada su pareja trabaja como joyero, tienen tres hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando y la otra niña tiene 7 meses de edad.   

Ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa, desde hace dos años; lo aprendió por medio de la suegra. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y también sale a vender ambulante. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar camisas, tangas, brasier, calcetines,  faldas para vender en la casa y ambulante.  Mejora su condición de vida,  ya que tendrá mejores condiciones de vida  y de ingresos para ella y su familia, será satisfecha ya que  tendrá más ingresos. 

Su propósito es, que su negocio de venta de ropa crezca y que su familia tenga una buena fuente  de ingresos, que sus hijos tengan buena condición de vida con los ingresos de sus ventas, las ganancias las invertirá para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 30, has a high school degree.  She is married, and her husband works as a jeweler.  They have 3 children, 2 of whom are in school.  Their youngest daughter is 7 months old.

Evelyn has had a business selling clothing for 2 years.  She learned this business from her mother-in-law.  Her business is located in her home, and she also goes out to sell from place to place.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy shirts, thong underwear, bras, socks, and skirts to sell from her home and on the street.  This will enable her to improve her living conditions, because she will be able to have more income for herself and her family.  She will be satisfied, because she will have more income. 

Evelyn's goal is to grow her clothing business so that her family can have a good source of income.  Also, she wants to use her earnings to give her children good living conditions and to invest so that her business can grow.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Rama

texts.en: Rama received a Kiva loan and he was able to repay the loan fully without many challenges. He wants to expand the existing business and add more stock so that he can reach more clients. His business improved after the previous loan. He was able to pay school fees for his children and provided a better life for them and now he wants another loan to buy more cooking utensils, basins, etc. The extra income that he will raise will improve the standards of living and educate the children.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, basins, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Gardnersville and is 48 years old, married with three children, ages 3 to16, and her husband is a technician. For the past 11 years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She learned how to sell from her friends, who gave her tips like keeping her business in one place. This business makes her proud. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future, she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 35 años de edad es madre soltera (Por Viudez) de 4 hijos, la mayor de las hembras estudia en secundaria, 2 niñas que estudian en primaria y el varón que es el único que se involucra en las actividades sobre el mantenimiento del café. Su fuente de ingresos es la producción y comercialización de café teniendo mucha experiencia en este rubro ya que desde muy joven trabaja en la agricultura las plantas que ella y su hijo trabajan fueron sembradas por su esposo quien falleció hace algún tiempo. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados muy cerca de su casa de habitación, como ventaja gracias a ello ella pueda dar asistencia y mantenimiento diariamente en compañía de su hijo; pero como único desafió que ella encuentra es la alza de los precios en los insumos que son utilizados para asistir el café ya que el precio de estos en el mercado es inestable y va de forma ascendente. 
Sus metas son las de mantener sanos y muy bien asistidos sus cultivos de café ya que por medio de las ganancias de este producto ella cubre las necesidades en el hogar y con los estudios de sus hijos siendo ella el único apoyo que ellos tienen. Sus sueños son los de poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que ellos puedan prepararse, ser personas con mejores oportunidades en la vida, mejores ideas para emprender negocios y ayudarla cuando ella ya no tenga fuerzas para trabajar. 
Martina ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar insumos agrícolas con los cuales podrá comprar insumos para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y cumplir con sus ideales, metas, esperanzas y sueños en su vida.
texts.en:
Martine, 35, is a single mother (she's a widow) of 4 children. The eldest daugter is in secondary school, two girls study in primary school and her son is the only one involved in the coffee business.

Her source of income is the production and sale of coffee, she has a lot of experience in this field as she has worked in agriculture since she was very young. The plants that she and her son tend were planted by her husband who died some time ago. Their crops are located very near to their home, which is an advantage as it means she can tend them daily accompanied with her son. The main disadvantage that is the rise in price of the supplies used to grow coffee as the prices in the market are unstable and are rising.

Her goals are to keep her coffee crops healthy and well cared for as she uses the earnings from this product to cover the household expenses and to pay for her children's education as she is the only support that they have. Her dreams are to be able to continue supporting her children's education so that they can be prepared for the best opportunities in life, have better ideas for business and to support her when she can no longer work.

Martina has requested financing from COMIXMUL in order to buy agricultural supplies to tend to her coffee crops and fulfil her ideals, goals, hopes and dreams for the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her grow coffee.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is a Cameroonian, aged 38 and married, with five children. The oldest is 12 and in secondary school, while the youngest is 1 year old. Laurence has been in this business for the past four years, which makes him very experienced and stable and his business profitable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover by 15 percent. His standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline lives in Kilifi county north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 29 years old, and she is married, with two children. 

She owns a small grocery store in town that she started six months ago. The business has been doing fine ever since she started. 

She now wants to move it to the next level by acquiring her own premises where she can do business. She knew Milango through friends who invited her, and she joined so that she could access funding for her small business.

She now seeks a loan to buy kale, cabbages, and potatoes. The major challenge that she faces is the competition from other traders and price instability. The extra income that she raises will improve her savings.

loans.use: to buy kale, cabbages, and potatoes

loans.name: Taphling

texts.en:
Taphling lives in the Likoni area. She is 27 years old and she is a single mother of two. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past year. She now feels that this is the right time to take her business to the next level. Both of her children attend school.

She knew Milango through friends who asked her to join them, and she did because she wanted to access funding for her business in the future. She now seeks a loan to buy a stock of shirts and skirts to sell in her business. The major challenge in the business is the competition for the available customers. The income that she will raise will help her to pay school fees for the two children that fully depend on her for provision.

loans.use: to buy a stock of shirts and skirts.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y pagó el gasto del hogar, ella continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Santa Ana” y sigue enseñando en uno de los colegios de la zona, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal como por ejemplo pagar el agua y la luz. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Alicia's grateful to the lenders for the loan, and she paid her household expenses.  She's still with Santa Ana Communal Bank and teaching in one of the area schools.

Alicia needs the current loan for personal expenses such as paying the water and electric bills.  She's grateful for and appreciates the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to pay for water and electricity

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 68 años de edad, estudio hasta 7° grado, es acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, son padres de 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 trabajan con él, también viven sus nietos.

Carlos se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace  40 años y a la ganadería, el trabajo lo aprendió por su padre. También se dedica a jornalero, el trabajo le queda a media hora de su casa viaja a pie, con él se involucra su hijo. 

El préstamo lo utilizara,  para mejorar su vivienda, ya que la casa se encuentra en malas condiciones, comprara polines y lamina para arreglar el techo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 68, studied until the 7th grade. He is married and his wife is engaged in household chores. They are the parents of 4 children of which 3 work with him. He also lives with his grandchildren.

Carlos earns his living in agriculture and raising livestock which he has done for 40 years. He learned this work from his father. He is also a day laborer who works a half an hour from his home with his son. 

This loan will be used to improve his home since the house is in poor condition. He will buy wooden beams and shingles to fix the roof.

loans.use: to purchase wooden beams and shingles to fix his roof and improve his home.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
This is Gocha, who is 24 years old and lives in the village of Kveda Sazano. He is single and lives with his parents. Gocha and his family members run a small-scale agricultural business and breed two milk cows. The family sells cheese for selling in grazing season, when the cows get milk.

As their earnings are not enough to cover utilities and food costs, Gocha has decided to diversify the business and start a small café in his district. According to Gocha’s estimations, sales will be high as the location where he plans to start his cafe is crowded with people. He has already hired the commercial space and needs money to purchase all the needed equipment and raw materials. 

The income from the café will be a great support for the family as it will generate additional income. Gocha appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed equipment and raw materials for starting a small food cafe in his district.

loans.name: Mika

texts.en:
Mika lives in Likoni area near Mombasa, Kenya. He is 27 years old and a father of one. He is a tailor by training and this is what he does for a living. He started the business with two sewing machines and customer materials. The business has grown over the past six years since he started the business.

He knew Milango through friends, and now seeks a loan to buy uniform materials for the upcoming high number of customers when children are joining school. In five years, he sees himself owning a very successful uniform company. If he generates enough income from the business, he will be able to open another different business to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy uniform materials.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman has been involved in stone grinding for more than 4 years. He earns his and his family's living by providing different stone grinding services to local stone manufacturing firms. Arman lives with his wife and one-year-old son in Arjut village of Lori region. Due to the tireless work that Arman has been doing over these years, he perfectly managed to sustain his family's living. 

Now, by asking this loan, Arman needs to purchase stone powder to be able to provide stone grinding services to one of the local companies. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is highly important for Arman to be able to complete the order received from his customer and continue his stone grinding business.

loans.use: to pay for stone powder to provide stone grinding service.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en: Miatta is 30 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s married and her husband is a business man. They have 3 children between the ages of 4 and 12. The children all live at home and attend school. For the past 7 years Miatta has been selling cosmetics. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en: Mupa is happy that she took a loan from Kiva and she was able to pay back the loan fully without challenges. She has seen growth in her business and she feels it is the time to pump in more capital. She now seeks another loan to buy rice, sugar and soap for her business. The profits from the previous loan helped to pay school fees for her children and she was also able to improve her standard of living. The challenges that she faces in the business include the competition and the pricing of commodities that sometimes cuts into the income, especially during the low season.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and soap for her business.

loans.name: Eric Pascal

texts.en:
Eric is a Cameroonian, age 39, and married with four children; the oldest is ten and in secondary school, while the youngest is two and in nursery school. He has been in this business for the past four years, which makes him very experienced, and his business stable and profitable. 

His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover by one hundred percent. His standard of living will be improved too.

loans.use: to buy stuff (soft drinks , biscuit , candy ,bread , soap, etc.) for his provisions store.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is a Cameroonian, forty-one-years-old and married with four children.  The oldest is twelve-years-old and is in secondary school, while the youngest is three-years-old in nursery school. She has been in this business for the past three years which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is located in an urban center near an administrative area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her profit by 65 percent. Her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy a used photocopier for her business.

loans.name: Kernedy Ane

texts.en: He has taken another loan because the first loan is fully paid. This loan will help him buy leather and other materials for the fabrication of shoes. The last loan helped him make a profit of more than sixty percent. His standard of living and that of his family has change positively.

loans.use: to buy leather and other materials to form shoes.

loans.name: Glenda Dina

texts.es:
Glenda es una joven de 27 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos que son menores los cuales estudian, en estado civil de unión libre la cual cuenta con un grado de escolaridad de primaria incompleta que no pudo culminar por la falta de apoyo económico ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos. Gracias al emprendimiento, confianza y compromiso que ella tiene, la cooperativa COMIXMUL la ha apoyado en todas y cada una de las veces que ella ha solicitado financiamiento para poder invertir en sus cultivos de papa creyendo en el pequeño productor y depositando confianza en esta clase de sector necesitado. Gracias a este rubro Glenda genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar y su familia con lo cual ayuda a la compra de calzado, medicinas con muchas restricciones, ropa, etc. que son necesarias para el cuidado y desarrollo de la salud. Fue gracias a sus padres que ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que ellos por generaciones han sido agricultores y siempre han trabajado la tierra. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y amigos. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 100 metros de distancia desde su casa de habitación a los cuales se traslada caminando por lo que también tiene la ventaja de asistir sus cultivos.
Sus planes y metas a futuro son los de poder arreglar su casa de habitación misma que necesita un techo digno, repello en sus paredes, y un piso de cemento evitando de esta manera la contaminación de virus en el sistema respiratorio por medio de la humedad en las paredes entre otras que están como familia propensas a sufrir. Como madre seguir apoyando a sus hijos con todas sus fuerzas para que ellos puedan graduarse a nivel superior y puedan ser personas de bien en la vida. Por lo que hoy día ella solicita una vez más apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que podrá asistir sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Glenda is a 27 year old mother of 4 young children who attend school. She is partnered in a common law marriage and she could not complete primary school because of the lack of financial support, as her parents did not have many economic resources. 
Thanks to her business venture and their trust in the commitment she has, the cooperative COMIXMUL has supported her every single time she has requested funding to invest in her potato crops because they believe in small producers and supporting this necessary sector with confidence. Thanks to this support, Glenda generates revenue for the maintenance of her household and family which helps with buying shoes, medicines with many restrictions, clothing, and more that are necessary for the minding and development of health. 
It was thanks to her parents that Glenda learned to work the land at an early age because they have been farmers for generations and have always worked the land. Her customers are the different intermediaries who come to the area as well as neighbors and friends. Her crops are located 100 meters away from her house which means that she has to walk to attend to her crops. 
Her plans and future goals are to be able to fix her house that needs a decent roof, plaster on the walls, and a cement floor so that they can avoid the contamination of viruses of the respiratory system that are passed between family members due to the humidity in the walls. 
As a mother, she will continue to support her children with all of her strength so that they can graduate to the next level and be good people in life. So today she again requests financial support for the purchase of agricultural inputs so that she may attend to her potato crops.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for her potato crops.

loans.name: Naftal

texts.pt:
Naftal tem 37  anos de idade, casado e pai  de 03 filhos. Ele trabalha das 07 horas até as 15horas numa instituição de apoio a desfavorecidos como controlador de stocks. 
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  material de construção( banheiras, lavatório e tijoleiras) para usar na construção da sua casa.
O seu maior sonho é de aumentar e terminar a sua casa e comprar mobiliário para melhorar as condições de habitação  e terminar a sua formação no ensino superior.
 Seu desafio é de pagar o seu empréstimo dentro do periodo pré-estabelecido de forma a pedir outro, Bem como criar os seus filhos.
texts.en:
Naftal is 37 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He works from 07h00 to 15h00 at an institution that supports the disadvantaged as a stock controller.

With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (bathtub, sink and bricks) to use in building his house.

His biggest dream is to expand and finish his house, to buy furniture to improve his living conditions and to finish his university education.

His challenge is to pay back his loan within the pre-agreed term in order to ask for another one, as well as to raise his children.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bathtub, sink and bricks)

loans.name: Nora

texts.pt:
Nora tem 34  anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 03 filhos. A sua base de sustento é o negócio ela trabalha todo dia vendendo bebidas diversas em sua casa para reforçar as suas receitas, trabalha no balcão de um restaurante.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  productos alimentares diversos como( bebidas, refregerantes, e outros ) para revender.
O seu maior sonho é de aumentar a sua casa e comprar mobiliário para melhorar as condições de habitação .
 Seu desafio é diversificar os produtos que vende para satisfazer a demanda.
texts.en:
Nora is 34 years old, single and the mother of 3 children. Her income comes from her business and she works every day selling various drinks from her home. To add to her revenues, she also works behind the bar is a restaurant.

With this loan she plans to buy various food products (such as drinks, sodas and other) to resell.

Her biggest challenge is to expand her house and buy furniture to improve her living conditions. Her challenge is to diversify her product offering to satisfy demand.

loans.use: buy various food products (such as drinks, sodas and other)

loans.name: Brenda Lisseth

texts.es: Brenda habita en el municipio de masaya, soltera trabajadora su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia, sus padres le han heredado un pedaso de terreno donde esta construyendo un cuarto para acondicionarlo y poder vivir alli, ella trabaja para una Universidad Privada, el credito lo solicita para comprar. bloques, hierro, estribos, cemento, arena, etc. agradecida por el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le estan brindado ya que por medio de ellos podra cumplir uno de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Brenda lives in the municipality of Masaya. She is single and hardworking, and her greatest dream is to have her own house. Her parents inherited a piece of land where she is building a house and equipping it so that she can live there. Brenda works for a private university.

Brenda is requesting this loan to buy blocks, iron, supports, cement and sand, etc. She says that she is grateful for the support that Kiva and the field partner are giving her, because with their support she will be able to realize one of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, supports, cement and sand, etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina continua brindando servicio de transporte interprovincial y sigue participando en el banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro entonces va comprar llantas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Paulina continues to provide interprovincial transportation service and still participates in the Santa Ana communal bank.  At this moment she requires the loan in order to perform maintenance on her vehicle - she is going to buy tires.  

She is thankful and appreciative of the loan, and promises to complete her monthly repayments on time and very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo  “El Progreso” conformada por 07 socios dispuestos a comenzar a trabajar en equipo. Carmen de 36 años es casada con 02 hijos menores de edad. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Carmen ha logrado apoyar a su familia, pues actualmente cuenta con 02 motos taxis la cual lo trabaja su esposo y ella brindado servicio de transporte.  Solicitó el crédito para darle mantenimientos a sus motos. Su mayor deseo es de instalar un puesto donde pueda vender prendas de vestir. El nuevo grupo “El Progreso” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Carmen está ubicada en la parte de adelante y viste chaleco marón y pantalón rosado.
texts.en: This is the new group "El Progreso" that is made up of 7 partners who are willing to begin working as a team. Carmen, 36, is married with 2 minor children. With great effort and dedication, Carmen has managed to support her family. She currently has 2 motorcycle taxis with which she and her husband provide services. She requested a loan for the maintenance of their motorcycles. Her biggest goal is to purchase a market stall where she can sell clothing. The new group "El Progreso" thanks the people who make this loan possible. Carmen is located in the front in the brown vest and pink pants.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Cristo Rey  está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Faviola es una de las integrantes, quien trabaja de manera exhaustiva, para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy luchadora, que con mucho esfuerzo pudo salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y así es que está procurando poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, ya que se acerca la época en la que más venta tiene y quiere poder seguir dando a sus clientes buenos productos.
texts.en:
The "Cristo Rey" group is on its fourth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme.  The group comes from the city of Concepción, a little way away from the centre of the country.  It is a growing area but difficult to access.  The members of "Cristo Rey" group want to fight to keep growing and to make their home region better and fight so that they can gradually grow too.

Faviola is one member of the group and she works tirelessly in order to be able to help her family.  Faviola is very feisty and, with a lot of effort, has been able to prosper.  Faviola makes a living selling various items and endeavours to continue supporting her family.

Faviola is applying for this loan in order to buy various items of clothing.  The season for high sales is approaching and Faviola wants to keep offering her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Elva Ysabel

texts.es:
Elva Ysabel tiene 57 años de edad, vive en su casa propia en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar y prendas de vestir, desde hace más de 10 años, sus ventas los realiza en su distrito y zonas aledañas al mismo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para su negocio ropa de temporada primavera – verano y artículo de cocina y de manera ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elva Ysabel is 57 years old and lives in a home of her own in the Cayalti district, located two hours from Chiclayuo on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there are merchants, farmers, and raise livestock.

She sells household products and clothing and has done so for more than 10 years and makes her sales within her district and in the surrounding areas.

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Soles to buy merchandise for her business, such as spring and summer clothing and kitchen items so she can offer a greater variety to her customers.  This will allow her to earn a greater income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a new borrower, age 35 years old, and married with two children. He deals in the sale of onions, and has a banana plantation from which he gets bananas for home consumption and sells the surplus. 

He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX, to improve his farming methods through pruning and weeding. He has a challenge of little business turnover from his commercial farming and low market purchase, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to hire manpower and expand both his farmland and agriculture.

In the photograph is Nicholas, his wife, and guarantor (left to right); they signed the waiver form.

loans.use: to hire laborers expand both his farmland and agriculture.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is a hairdresser with three years of experience working in that field. From the small rented space in one of the local beauty salons, Alvard provides different types of hairdressing services. She is very kind and careful toward her clients who value the service that Alvard greatly provides. 
Now for being able to increase her working capital, Alvard needs financial support. She asks for this loan to be able to purchase materials and tools needed for her work. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Alvard to serve her clients in better way and will increase the quality of work she provides.
Alvard lives alone in the town of Vanadzor as her only son serves in the army.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools to provide a hairdressing service.

loans.name: Kyabugimbi Twetungure Group

texts.en:
Kyabugimbi is a new group located in Kitondo Kyabugimbi Ntungamo district. It is comprised of men and women whose major activity is farming. They are all married with their children in schools. 

They applied for a loan of UGX 3,900,000 as a group which will be shared between the individuals. They have the challenge of low production within their businesses due to poor farming methods -- banana wilt among others. 

Their prime target is to change the lives of their families and also to take their children to better schools rather than having them get a poor education. However, they have limited capital funds to enable them to achieve their dreams. 

With this loan they believe their production will improve as will their lifestyle and their society. Betty will use her loan to buy pesticides and better quality seeds. At the back in a tie and jacket is the Ugafode credit officer who is charge of them.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Anjik

texts.en:
Anjik is from Spitak town where she lives with her husband and two children. She is involved in a retail business. Particularly she has been selling fruits and vegetables from the local open market for 5 years already. The income from this activity is very important for Anjik and her family. Her husband works at a local company but their salaries together are hardly enough for covering family's basic needs. 

Because of family's current poor conditions, Anjik would like to enlarge her sales of fruits and vegetables. She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of fruits and vegetables in bulk for being able to resell it during the winter season. Anjik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for Anjik and her whole family, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables in bulk for selling in the winter season.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak is a young and enthusiastic lady from Armavir town. After graduating from the university she started to provide computer training to local students. She prepares different term papers, essays and trainings for local students and gets income which is enough for covering her daily costs. 

As a young and hardworking lady, Arusyak is well known among students and she receives a lot of orders during a month. Unfortunately, her computer has broken down and she isn't able to continue her work. By applying for this loan Arusyak asks financial support for being able to purchase a new computer. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Arusyak to be able to continue her work. She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a new computer for the preparation of term papers, essays and trainings.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Ramatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  After she got married, Ramatu established her local food business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of transportation.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to buy more cassava grain and palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Ramatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cassava grain and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a widowed woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a committed person. She operates a grocery store where she sells groceries. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit four family members.  She will also add stock of grocery products for resale.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water and add stock of grocery products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 28-year-old married woman. She has one child who is nine years old. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit three family members.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un señor casado de 27 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y su hijo de tres años en el Departamento de Sololá.
Actualmente se dedica a la albañilería a unos metros de su vivienda, esta actividad la eligió porque desde pequeño fue ayudante de albañil y es así como fue adquiriendo experiencia en esta labor. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayuda a contribuir a los gastos de su familia,  como también su esposa realiza bordados en su domicilio, con el fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos.
Ahora ha tomado la decisión de tener un negocio que le genere más ingresos, es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,200.00 para comprar un pequeño terreno en donde pueda cultivar maíz y otras verduras, con el propósito de mejorar la economía de su familia. El préstamo lo pagara con los ingresos de su trabajo.
Su sueño es mejorar la estructura de su vivienda para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Fernando is a married man aged 27, who lives with his wife and their 3-year-old son in the Sololá department.
He is currently employed as a mason, working not too far away from his house. He chose this activity because he used to help a mason when he was a kid, and has consequently gained some experience in this line of work. Thanks to his activity he earns an acceptable income that helps him paying for his family’s expenses; his wife, in her turn, works as an embroider in their house, in order to help him facing their expenses.
He has now decided to run a shop in order to earn a better income, and for this reason he is requesting a loan of 3,200.00 GTQ to buy a small lot of land where to grow corn and other vegetables, as he aims at improving the economic condition of his family. He will repay the loan with the income he earns with his job.
He dreams of improving the framework of his house so that his family can enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a small lot of land.

loans.name: Mikel

texts.en:
Mikel is a 24-year-old married Roma who has two young children. He lives in a major city in central Albania where most of his community lives. Their main activity is buying & selling fabric raw materials and also second-hand clothing. What they sell has always been in demand since the majority of Albanians are indeed poor, so buying a sweater for 3 or 4 bucks or buying fabric material to stitch their own clothes are very good deals. 

Some of the Romas sell at their market or they just sell in the streets. Basically there is one in every city or town. Either way turns out to be profitable.
Mikel wants to stock up on winter inventory items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raúl  tiene 37 años, casado con dos hijos de 6 y 9 años, él se dedica a la venta de madera en cantidad,  él vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Raúl  va a usar este préstamo para compra de una motosierra ya que esto le permitirá realizar más rápido el corte de la madera , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  el señor Raúl  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su casa, el  señor Raúl  es una persona con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en: Raúl is 37 years old, he is married and he has two children aged 6 and 9. He engages in selling large quantities of wood. He lives in the town of Puerto Rico, ad this is the first loan he takes with the institutions. Raúl will use this loan to buy a chainsaw, so that he will cut more wood in less time. He is requesting this loan to increase his earnings. Raúl has to face a few challenges in his job, such as improving his activity as well as his standard of living, and he will use the profits to buy electrical household appliances for his house. Raúl is a man that wants to succeed in life, and he fells happy for having been given the chance to improve his activity and consequently his income, this being the only job he has.

loans.use: To buy a chainsaw.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en: Keziah is a 27-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 7 years. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes new clothes and also repairs clothes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a low stock of clothes. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. It will benefit five family members. She will also add a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from Tairov village in the Armavir region. Together with her husband (in the photo) Naira is involved in a shoe sewing business. They have agreements with a number of shoe stores who provide permanent orders to Naira and then sell her shoes in their stores. Naira now asks for this loan in order to be able to purchase materials. This will enable her to increase the number of shoes she and her husband are sewing and increase sales. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Naira and her husband, and she hopes that lenders will support her shoe sewing business.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing shoes.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram has been involved in providing welding services for over 10 years. He lives with his daughter. His son serves in the army and his wife currently is in Russia. Aram works hard to gather enough income for covering the family's basic costs. Now, realizing the current demand of the welding service that Aram provides, he would like to expand it. 

By applying for this loan, Aram asks financial support for purchasing raw materials and a new welding machine. This will allow him to get involved in the preparation of outer doors for houses and thus enlarge his business.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan will help Aram very much and he will be able to enlarge the welding business that he is involved in.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and a new welding machine for providing welding services.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 32 years old. He is a boda boda (motorcycle) driver. He began his business to support his family's needs. 

He will use the loan buy iron sheets and timber for construction so that he can complete his family's residential house and accommodate his people well. 

His clients are the regular people that move from place to place. His challenge is the rainy season. He is a hardworking man. In the photo is the client and the Ugafode credit officer. (left to right)

loans.use: To buy iron sheets and timber.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is in her late thirties and married with 2 children. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo in the Western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started the business because she wants to strive for her daily bread.  

She's been in this business since she got married and sells glass plates, knives and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem to her business is having an improper business location.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more glass plates and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and build a permanent business structure. In the future, she would like to build a boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more glass plates and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Gardnersville, is 43-years-old and married with three children between the ages of fourteen and twenty-six, all of whom live at home and three still attend school. For the past five years, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant).  She learned this way of selling from her mother and started her business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys the flow of her customers and the profit she makes each day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, salt, pepper, oil and onions for her business.  In the future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, salt, pepper, oil and onions for her restaurant.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Isatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. Isatu established her used clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more men's trousers and shirts for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her children's welfare. In the future Isatu plans to own a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more mens' trousers and shirts for resale.

loans.name: Graciela Isabel

texts.es: Graciela habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a sus 3 hijos de 2 años de 4 años y 21 años de edad.  Desde hace mucho tiempo se separó de su esposo y  es quien asumió la responsabilidad del hogar. Con muchas dificultades va sacando adelante a sus hijos quienes cada día le demandan más ya que están creciendo y necesitan más atenciones. Graciela se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva dese hace mucho tiempo. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es así como logra sacar lo necesario para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación de su vivienda ya que necesita cambio de techo y repellar las paredes ya que con las lluvias se han dañado. El crédito lo invertirá para comprar materiales como, lámina galvanizada, madera, arena y cemento. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Graciela lives in very humble conditions along with her three children who are 21, 4, and 2 years old.  She has been separated from her husband for a long time, and is the one who has assumed responsibility for her home.  With great difficulty she gets her children ahead in life even though they demand more each day since they are growing and need more attention.  

For a long time, Graciela has made a living selling new clothing.  This business is her main source of income and is how she manages to get what is necessary to maintain her home.  She asks FUSAI for this loan in order to repair her house.  She needs to change the roof and plaster the walls because the rain has damaged them.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of materials like galvanized sheet metal, wood, sand, and cement.  She hopes she can rely on this support and thus be able to provide better housing conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, sand, and cement in order to repair the roof and to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 53 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 6 meses, 3 años y de 7 años de edad. Para él lo más importante es que su familia se encuentre en buenas condiciones ya que es lo más importante que tiene en la vida. Juan se dedica a la reparación de bicicletas y la construcción de estructuras metálicas, este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos permitiéndole llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Desea hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda tales como repellar las paredes, encementar el piso e instalar la energía eléctrica ya que  desea dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones para su desarrollo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, grava e instalación de la energía eléctrica.
texts.en: Juan, who is 53 years old, lives in his own house along with his life companion and their three children, ages 6 months, 3, and 7. For him, the most important thing is that his family have good living conditions, since they are the most important thing he has in life. Juan works in repairing bicycles and building metal structures. This business is his principle source of income, allowing him to bring daily sustenance to his household. He wants to make some improvements in his residence such as plastering the walls, cementing the floor, and installing electrical service, since he wants to give his children better conditions for their development. For these reasons, he is applying to FUSAI to invest in the purchase of sand, cement, and gravel and the installation of electrical service.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and gravel and install electrical service.

loans.name: Young Generation B Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Young Generation B” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to add more inventories into their respective businesses. 

The featured leader of this group is Adamsay. Adamsay is age 32. She was born in  Yoni in northern Sierra Leone, but she is currently residing in Waterloo together with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school. For 5 years now,  Adamsay has been selling fish. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Marta tem 48 anos de idade é divorciada  e mãe de 04 filhos dos quais apenas um é que vive com ela.     A sua base de sustento é o negócio.
 Com o empréstimo ela pretende comprar cerveja, refrescos  e amendoim para  revender em sua casa.
 Seu maior sonho é de terminar a sua casa e encontrar emprego para trabalhar.
Tem como desafio comprar produtos ha tempo porque sempre neste periodo do ano os preços sobem muito.
texts.en:
Marta is 48 years old, divorced and the mother of 4 children, only one of whom lives with her. Her livelihood is her business.

With this loan she plans to buy beer, sodas and peanuts to resell from her home.

Her biggest dream is to finish her house and find a job so that she can work.
Her challenge is to buy products on time because at this time of the year prices go up a lot.

loans.use: buy beer, sodas and peanuts to resell from her home.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Pacca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACCA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luisa tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de verduras, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimento para sus animales.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de ganadería, venta de ropa, crianza de animales menores como cuyes, venta de verduras, venta de maíz, crianza de animales, venta de granos secos, tienda de abarrotes.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of “Inmaculada Concepción de Pacca”, a Communal Bank located in Anta, a district in Anta province of the Cusco department.
Luisa is 54 years old, she is a widow and she has 3 children. She alternated her daily chores with breeding small animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and chicken, among others. She breeds these animals to then sell them to customers who request them; she has been engaged in this activity for quite some time now, and things are going well thanks to the efforts she daily works with. At times she also engages in selling vegetables. She is a responsible and persevering woman, as it is through these activities that she provides for her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy cuyes and animal feed for her animals.
The other members engage in cattle raising, clothes selling, breeding small animals such as cuyes, vegetable selling, corn selling, animal breeding, selling dried grains, running a general store.
She is grateful to those that will help her making her dream come true through this mean, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy cuyes and animal feed.

loans.name: Pablo Leandro

texts.es: El señor Pablo  tiene 32 años, casado con dos hijos de 8 y 9 años, él se dedica a la construcción y al pintado de viviendas, el es albañil contratista se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Pablo  va a usar este préstamo para compra de pintura por mayor ya que está pintando ambientes en su casa, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia,  el señor Pablo  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su trabajo día a día, el  señor Pablo  tiene muchos contratos por realizar trabajos de muy buena calidad es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en: Pablo is 32, and is married with two children aged 8 and 9. He works in construction and in house-painting. He has been a hired construction worker for quite some time. This is his first loan with the institution, and Pablo wants to use it to buy wholesale paint, a he is painting parts of his home. His reason for requesting the loan is to make life more comfortable for his family. Pablo is facing challenges in his business, namely, improving his work from day to day. He has a lot of high-quality contracts to fulfil. Pablo is a hard-working person and feels happy to have this opportunity to improve his work.

loans.use: to buy wholesale paint.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Yungaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Ceferina ella es viuda  tiene 72 años y tiene 4 hijos ; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores ,la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos  a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para sus animales. 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ganados, plastiqueria, farmacia, tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of “Inmaculada Concepción de Yungaqui II”, a Communal Bank located in Cusco, a district in the Cusco province of the Cusco department.
Ceferina is 72 years old and she has 4 children. She alternates her daily chores with breeding small animals. She breeds them to then sell them to customers who request them during the different fairs held in her area. She has been engaged in this activity for quite some time now, and things are going well thanks to the efforts she daily works with. She wishes to keep on working in order to continue supporting her family.
