She is requesting a loan to buy “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig)and animal feed for her animals.
The other members’ engage in animals selling, cattle selling, silversmith, running a chemist’s, running a general store and in agriculture.
She is grateful to those that will help her making her dream come true through this mean, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy cuyes and animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Dutezanyimbere Cb Group

texts.en: Dutezanyimbere is a group composed of different members selling different items. Dutezanyimbere in English means "lets grow together” and is led by Donatha. She is married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and beans for sale. The profits from the business she expects to use in making more savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Janeth Elizabeth

texts.es:
Janeth de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta 9°grado, está  acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, la cliente tiene un hijo de un año de edad.
 
Janeth tiene un año de administrar su propia tienda, este trabajo lo aprendió por sí sola, también vende tortillas, queda a media hora de su casa, ya que le vende a los jornaleros del caserío.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar frijoles, arroz, churro, café  y diferentes productos para la venta, mejorara su negocio, ya que su tienda va crecer en productos y clientes.

Su propósito es, que su tienda crezca y que sea la mejor del caserío y así su familia, tenga mejores ingresos, las ganancias las utilizara para ampliar el negocio y para tener una mejor condición de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Janeth is 22 years old, married, and went to school until the ninth grade. Her husband works in construction, and she has a one-year-old son.

Janeth has for a year now been running her own store, which she learned how to do on her own. She also sells tortillas a half an hour from her home, where she sells them to day laborers in the area.

Janeth is requesting this loan to buy beans, rice, chips, coffee and a variety of products to offer for sale, and to improve her business, since she says that her store is going to grow both in terms of products and customers.

Janeth says that her goal is to grow her store and to make it the best in the area. She would like her family to have a better income. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, chips, coffee and other items.

loans.name: Adriana Elizet

texts.es: Adriana actualmente se encuentra desempleada por lo que se encarga de su hogar y de cuidar su familia, conformada por su esposo y su único hijo de 7 años de edad. Ella, con su espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de superarse y salir adelante, la impulsan a buscar alternativas que le permitan lograrlo, por ello está decidida a montar su propio negocio, un café internet y miscelánea, para lo cual ya posee el local, que es propiedad de su esposo, pero requiere el apoyo del crédito para comprar 4 computadores, escritorios, sillas y surtido de papelería y variedades, adicionalmente realizará adecuaciones del espacio, así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, en el que trabajará de Lunes a Domingo de 9:00 am a 10:00 pm; aprovechando la ventaja que tiene de no poseer competencia cercana en el sector donde estará ubicado el establecimiento. Adriana es consciente que para sacar su negocio adelante, debe trabajar con empeño, dedicación y disciplina, pues es la clave para que éste sea rentable y perdure en el tiempo, generando una estabilidad económica que le permita apoyar a su esposo con el sustento diario y solventando las necesidades básicas del hogar, logrando tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Adriana is unemployed at present and is busy with her home and caring for her family, which is composed of her husband and her one son, who is 7 years old. Adriana, with her enterprising spirit and desire for achievement and to get ahead, was motivated to search for alternatives that would permit her to achieve that. As a result, she decided to create her own business, an Internet cafe and miscellany store.

She already has her location – it belongs to her husband – but she needs the assistance of a loan to purchase 4 computers, desks, chairs, and a selection of paper and other supplies. She also needs to prepare the space. In this manner, she can launch her productive project, where she will work Monday through Sunday from 9:00 am until 10:00 pm. Adriana wants to seize the advantage she has, having no competition in the sector where her business will exist.

Adriana is conscious of the fact that in order to advance her business, she must work with enterprise, and discipline, key to making it profitable and survive over time. She wishes to generate an economic stability that will allow her to help her husband with daily sustenance, providing the basic necessities for the home, and leading to a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: buy 4 computers, desks, chairs, and a selection of paper and supplies, and to prepare new space.

loans.name: Munmun

texts.en:
Munmun is a 21-year-old housewife who lives with her husband Ratan aged 26 years. They live in a kaccha (mud and straw-made) house in a small village called Sahapara in Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri Dristict. They are raising their two daughters together. Their daughters are too young for school.  Munmun studied until class VIII (Grade 8) and her husband passed class V (Grade 5).

Munmun’s husband is a water distributor who distributes pure drinking water door to door in their locality and earns money. Her husband purchases pure drinking water and delivers to different houses and shops by cycle van. There is a scarcity of drinking water in that area, so they have chosen this business. 

Due to lack of finances, their business is not running well. So Munmun wants to help her husband and applied for a loan from BJS to purchase drinking water to increase the profit of their business. 
	
Munmun is a very ambitious young lady, who never wants to look back but wants to prosper in life. She and her husband are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva as they have extended their hand to help. She hopes Kiva & BJS will be beside her in future days if she needs more assistance.

loans.use: to purchase drinking water for distribution in her locality.

loans.name: Yashoda

texts.en:
Yashoda is 27 years old, married to Ganesh, has three children, and lives in the small village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri. They have three daughters who go to school. Yashoda is very ambitious for her daughters. 

Her husband is a barber and works in a salon. It’s very hard to run the family with this small income because he cannot keep all the profits for himself. That’s why Yashoda wants to take out a loan to build their own shop so that he can earn more money and provide a better education for their children. 

Her future dream is to give a good lifestyle to her daughters.

loans.use: To build a barber shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a creative person. She operates a greengrocery where she sells vegetables and other items. She describes her family challenge to be the lack of enough water for domestic use. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit three family members. She hopes that in the future, she will live a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. Fatmata established her retail materials business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more food containers and wax cotton material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her children's welfare. In the future Fatmata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food containers and wax cotton material for resale.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a retail business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married. She sells soap within her community and says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to take care of her family.

Adama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil and soap to prepare her soap business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and soap to prepare her soap business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, a married  mother of four, describes herself as a determined person. She operates a farm where she grows crops. Her family challenge involves obtaining water for domestic use. 

Beatrice will use this Kes 32700 loan to buy a 5000 litre water tank to store clean water for the domestic use of seven people. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her life.

loans.use: to buy a 5000 litre water tank

loans.name: Milagro Esther

texts.es: Milagro es una mujer de 40 años de edad a quien la vida la ha bendecido con 4 hermosos hijos  quienes a la fecha son menores de edad y habitan junto a ella y a su esposo. Milagro se dedica  a la venta de productos por catálogo, este negocio le ayuda  a llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que día con día se preocupa por darles lo mejor. Con el fin de mejorar y asegurar sus condiciones habitación solicita este crédito a FUSAI ya que desea repellar las paredes de su casa las cuales son a base de adobe y con las lluvias y el sol se están deteriorando y es necesario protegerlas lo antes posible. Con el crédito comprará cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Milagro, 40, has been blessed with four beautiful children who live with her and her husband. She makes a living selling products from a catalog. This business helps her to sustain her family. Her family is the most important thing to her, which is why she works to give them the best every day. 

In order to improve and secure her living conditions, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to plaster the walls of her home. The walls are made of adobe and are deteriorating due to rain and sun, so she needs to protect them as soon as possible. With this loan, she will buy cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Oscar Ismael

texts.es: Oscar de 23 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad.  Su esposa Trabaja en su casa y es quien se dedica al trabajo doméstico del hogar. Oscar trabaja como empleado en una empresa de su localidad y así se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su deseo es dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir  en la compra de cemento, arena y grava ya que las paredes de su vivienda son de adobe y se están deteriorando con las lluvias. Además, desea encementar el piso ya que en la actualidad es de tierra.
texts.en:
Oscar, 23, lives in very humble conditions along with his spouse and three-year-old daughter. His wife works at home and takes care of the household duties. Oscar works for a company in his town, earning a living to sustain his household. 

His wish is to offer his family better living conditions, which is why he is applying for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel. The walls of his home are made of adobe and are deteriorating due to rain. He would also like to lay down cement on the floor of his home, because he currently has a dirt floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to plaster walls and lay down a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Laila

texts.pt:
Laila  tem 30  anos de idade, solteira e mãe  de 01 filho . Ela trabalha todos os dias vendendo roupas diversas por entrega nas empresas. Todos os meses viaja para paises vizinhos comprar sua mercadoria.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  produtos como( lenções e roupas ) para revender .
O seu maior sonho é de aumentar e construir a sua casa e comprar mobiliário para melhorar as condições de habitação  e construir um estabelecimento para lazer e acomodação.
 Seu desafio é de pagar o seu empréstimo dentro do periodo pré-estabelecido de forma a pedir outro, bem como criar o seu filho
texts.en:
Laila  is 30 years old, single and the mother of 1 son. She works every day selling various clothes by delivering them to companies. Every month she travels to neighbouring countries to buy her merchandise.

With this loan she plans to buy products such as sheets and clothes to resell.

Her biggest dream is to expand and finish building her house, to buy furniture to improve her living conditions and to build an establishment for leisure and accommodation.
Her challenge is to pay off her loan within the pre-agreed term so she can ask for another one, as well as to raise her son.

loans.use: buy products such as sheets and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Julieta  tem 36 anos de idade, casada  e mãe de 03 filhos. A sua base de sustento é o negócio ela trabalha das 6 horas até as 20 vendendo bebidas diversas em sua casa.  Para além disso ela tem feito viagens para paises visinhos comprar produtos para revender a grosso.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  productos alimentares diversos como( bebidas, refregerantes, arroz, e outros ) para revender.
O seu maior sonho é de comprar uma viatura para facilitar no transporte de seus mercadorias. Gostaria igualmente de construir uma capoeira e criar patos e galinhas.
 Seu desafio é de fazer poupanças para comprar a viatura e material de construção para construir a capoeira.
texts.en:
Julieta is 36 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. Her livelihood is her business and she works from 06h00 to 20h00 selling various drinks from her home. In addition to this, she has made trips to neighbouring countries to buy products so that she can wholesale them.

With this loan she plans to buy various food products such as drinks, sodas, rice and others for resale.

Her biggest dream is to buy a vehicle to facilitate the transport of her products. She would equally like to build a chicken coop and raise ducks and hens.
Her challenge is to save in order to buy a vehicle and construction materials to build the chicken coop.

loans.use: buy various food products such as drinks, sodas, rice and others for resale.

loans.name: Flamme De Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Dieudonne est le coordinatrice de son groupe Flamme de Dilaire. Elle est mariée, elle a 4 enfants. Dieudonne habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee. Elle dirige son commerce de vente de chaussures (sandales), vetement et d'accessoires pendant plus d'une 11 d' annee. Avant de se commercer elle était une couturiere et ecoliere a la fois. 

Dieudonné va investir votre prêt lors de l'achat des sandales, vetement, sacs à main, bijoux, cosmetiques pour la revente. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres du groupe Flamme de Dilaire ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce que ventes cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, chaussures, vetement, etc. Dieudonne déclare que son défit principal est de devenir une grande commerçante et dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera a construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Dieudonné is the coordinator of the group Flamme De Dilaire. She is married, has four children, and lives in the northeast region of Haiti where electricity is rare and portable water is very limited. She has been selling shoes (sandals), clothing and accessories for more than 11 years. Before she started this business, she was a seamstress by trade and formerly a student.

Dieudonné will invest your loan by buying sandals, clothing, handbags, jewelry, and cosmetics for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her grow her business. Other members of the group Flamme De Dilaire need loans to support their businesses in cosmetics, soft drinks, shoes, clothes, etc. Dieudonné says her main challenge is to grow her business so that she can achieve her goal of one day constructing a large house with the help of Esperanza International.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products, including clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Intihuatana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIHUATANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marleni ella es conviviente tiene 40 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,la socia vende a sus animales a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en sus negocios para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales (cuyes)y alimentos para sus animales.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de maíz, venta de Flórez, venta de ropa, crianza de animales menores, restaurante y maestro de obra.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of “Intihuatana”, a Communal Bank located in Urcos, a district in Quispicanchis province of the Cusco department.
Marleni lives with her life partner, she is 40 and she has one child. She alternates her daily chores with breeding small animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and chicken, among others. She has been engaged in this activity for quite some time now, and things are going well thanks to the efforts she daily works with. She sells her animals to customers who request them. At times she engages in agriculture. She wishes to keep on engaging in her activities, in order to keep on supporting her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy cuyes and animal feed for her animals.
The other members engage in selling vegetables, selling corn, selling flowers, selling clothes, breeding small animals, running a restaurant and as a tradesman.
She is grateful to those that will help her making her dream come true through this mean, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy cuyes and animal feed.

loans.name: Manos De Trabajo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Manos de Trabajo está conformado por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, luchadores, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la obligación de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Y luchan día a  día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es María Victoria y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, verduras, tiste, fosforos, huevos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Manos de Trabajo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Manos de Trabajo" (Working Hands) consists of eight members, six women and two men. They are responsible mothers and fathers, with 15 children in their care. They are natives of Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern zone of the country. They are characterized as being hard-working and striving, with great personal will to achieve. Unfortunately, due to lack of resources, they were not able to go to school, and they found themselves obliged to work from an early age to help with the household expenses. They strive day after day to offer a better future to their children.

Thanks to her efforts and will to advance, the coordinator of the bank is Maria Victoria. Her business is a grocery store. It is a little store that sells food products in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, vegetables, tiste (a cocoa-basaed beverage), matches, and eggs. She works in her business some 12 hours a day, offering her products from her home. The purpose of her loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with edible products, so that in the not-too-distant future, she can obtain better income. The communal bank Manos de Trabajo appreciates the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce economic resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, vegetables, tiste (a cocoa-based beverage), matches, and eggs.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de tranporte,el socio realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles ,el tambien se dedica al ngeocio de compra y venta de madera,el socio tiene varios años en sus pequeños negocios,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Nazario continues to work providing taxi services on various streets, as well as buying and selling wood. He has had these small businesses for several years. His dream is to have a new car. He is applying for this loan to buy tires.

He feels grateful for this loan and he is committed to paying the established installments.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria agradece a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el crédito anterior y se siente muy contenta, ella sigue viviendo en la comunidad de Mika y sigue dedicándose a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a  la artesanía, a la venta de verduras y a la crianza de animales menores (Gallinas, Cuyes y Chanchos) por lo tanto ella continua participando en el banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y fertilizantes.
texts.en: Victoria is grateful to all of the lenders who supported her with her previous loan. She is very happy. She still lives in the village of Mika and works in agriculture, livestock, artisan crafts, selling vegetables and raising small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She is still a member of the communal bank in the Arariwa Association. On this occasion she is applying for a loan to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a determined person. She operates a farm where she grows crops. Grace describes her family challenge as a lack of enough water storage facilities. She will use the 32,700 KES loan to buy a 5000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit eight family members. Grace hopes that in the future, she will have enough clean water. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 5000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.en:
Albertine, age 46, makes and sells banana juice to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for three years. She and her husband have two children.

With her loan funds, Albertine will buy more bananas so that she can make and sell her locally-made banana juice. The expected profits will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy bananas so that she can make and sell her locally-made banana juice

loans.name: Mollika

texts.en:
Mollika is a 28-year-old woman who passed class IX (Grade 9). Her husband is Jagadish, who is 38 years old and a car-driver by profession. He is illiterate and can only sign his name. They live with their two sons in their own pacca (brick-built) house at Bagnan in the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri . Both their sons receive education. One is in class I (Grade 1) and the other is in class V (Grade 5).

Mollika is a very energetic entrepreneur.  She herself tries to help her family financially by selling firewood. She has chosen this business as she can get enough supply of wood in their village.  Moreover, there is less risk in this business.    She learned that micro finance help small-scale traders to carry out economic projects and she applied for a loan from BJS.

With this loan she wants to purchase firewood to increase her stock. Mollika hopes that this loan will help her to expand her firewood business, which will bring in more income. Her family's living standards will definitely improve and it will add value to her business and allow the future education of their children.

loans.use: To purchase firewood  to sell in her locality

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is a 23-year-old woman, mother of four children.  She lives with her children and husband Bimol, 31 years old, at Baroghoria in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own small kachha (straw and mud-made) house.  She is a housewife and did not attend a modern school, but received education up to class V (Grade 5) in their village.  One of their children goes to school and reads in class I ( Grade 1). The other two are below school-going age.

Krishna's husband, Bimol, attended school to class VII (Grade 7).  He is a greengrocer by trade. He is the only source of income of their family. But these days the prices of essential goods are increasing by leaps and bounds. So it is impossible for Bimol to meet the expenses of his family.  Nowadays Krishna needs to support her family financially.

To provide sustenance for her family, she has applied for a loan to BJS.  She wants to buy a cow with the loan to start her dairy products business, selling in the local market.   She thinks she will earn good profit from this business as dairy products have good demand in the present market.  Moreover, cow-dung is a good fertilizer, which can be used in their farming land.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start a dairy product business.

loans.name: Rupa

texts.en:
Rupa, age 25, is married to Bablu and they have three children (two sons and one daughter). Two sons go to school. They are in primary classes. Their daughter is below school-going age. 

They live in a kachha house (a house made of mud, bamboo, straw, etc.) Bablu is a greengrocer, selling vegetables in the market, and his income is not sufficient to bear all the household expenses of the family. Rupa decided to help her husband financially. She wants to buy a cow and sell the dairy products like milk, curd, paneer (fresh homemade cheese) in the market. With the profit she will meet the family expenses and educational expenses of the children. 

In her future she dreams of building up a dairy farm with many cows.  She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and sell dairy products in the market

loans.name: Parul

texts.en:
Parul is a 45-year-old housewife and mother of three children. She received an education up to class IX (Grade 9).  Her husband, Shibendra, aged 55 years, is in the pharmacy business.  He passed X standard ( Grade 10). They have their own kachha (mud and straw-made) house in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Parul's two daughters are married and her only son, engaged in the timber business.

These days the prices of essential goods are increasing vigorously. So it is impossible for Shibendra to meet all the expenses of his family. Parul decided to help her husband financially in her own way.  Then she started her own business of selling firewood in her locality.   She has been running the business for more than a year, but the lack of capital does not permit her to expand her business.

Hence the importance of this loan for her work, as it allows her to increase her stock of firewood. As it is a profitable business, she applied for the loan from BJS to purchase firewood.

She hopes that with the loan she will be able to purchase the small necessities needed by her family. Parul plans to reinvest a part of her income in her business. Parul is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for selling in her locality

loans.name: Sobita

texts.en:
Sobita lives at Tekatuli in the small town of Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri  with her three children and her husband, Suresh.  Sobita is a 26-year-old housewife and illiterate; she can only sign her name.  Her husband, 30 years old, did not complete secondary education.  Two of their children; two sons, go to school and read in class VII Grade 7) and class V (Grade 5).  The third one is below school-going age. They live in their own pacca (brick-built) house.

Sobita's husband runs a tailoring shop. But due to lack of capital, they are unable to invest properly to expand their business. Their earnings from their work is too low to support a family. So they face great difficulty affording the cost of their children's education and food expenses.

Sobita thought to do something on her own, but to do something there is need of capital. Then she came to know about BJS and has taken out loan to purchase raw materials (cloth, thread, needles, etc.) for their business.   She and her husband both are thankful to BJS and KIVA.

Her future plan is to make her business run smoothly, upgrade their poor financial condition, and give a better future to their children,.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for their tailoring shop.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is 27 years old, married and raising two children, together with her husband.  Nilima is illiterate and can only sign her name.  Her husband Kamal has an education up to class V ( Grade 5).  He is 39 years old and a car driver by trade.  They are providing education to both their son and daughter. They are in class V (Grade 5) and class III (Grade 3) respectively.  They have a semi-pacca (brick-wall, straw roof) house in the small town of Moynaguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri.


To provide the primary income for her family, Nilima is involved in animal husbandry.  Thanks to her hard work and dedication.  But due to the small income of both husband and wife, they are unable to give a good living standard to their family.  So she applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cow to start a business selling milk, which has a great demand in their locality.


She hopes to earn more profits from the business, so that she can meet the increasing household expenses, give better education to her children, and upgrade their semi-kachha house to a pacca (brick) one.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start a business selling milk.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Mamusu, age 30, sells glasses, cups, knives, and food containers within her community to earn a living. She lives and works in Tombo, a western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started her business after she was married because she wanted to improve her family's living conditions. She and her husband have two children.

She reports that the main problem she encounters in her business is that she offers her wares from an ineffective, temporary location.

Mamusu has requested a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to offer for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and build a permanent business structure. 

In the future, she would like to open a larger shop. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to offer for sale

loans.name: New London Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the New London Group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Aminata is the featured leader of this group. Aminata is 27 years old and married with two children; one is in primary school and the other is still not of school-going age. Aminata sells cigarettes, biscuits, sugar, milk, mints, etc., and has been a businesswoman for one year now. With the help of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy, biscuits, sugar, milk, mints, cigarettes, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Remember We Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Remember We” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ramatu is the featured leader of this group. Ramatu is 39 years old; she is married with three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school.  Ramatu sells slippers and lengths of cloth and has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of slippers and lengths of cloth to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers and lengths of cloth to add to her current stock

loans.name: Fleurs Roses De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Isemene est  la coordinatrice de son groupe Fleurs Roses de Ouanaminthe. Elle est marie et elle a  3 enfants. Ele habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l'eau portable est très limitée. elle contient La boutique pendant les 4 dernieres années.

Avant de faire ce commerce  Isemene fait la couture, elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son business. Des autres membres de son groupe ont besoin d’un  emprunt pour faire le commerce tel que ventes produits alimentaires, boissons gazeuses,  nourriture, etc.  Elle  dit que son défit  principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans sa vie. 

Elle dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un camion qui lui facilitera à un plus grand clientele, avec les prêts de Esperanza.
texts.en: Isemene is the coordinator of the Fleurs Roses De Ouanaminthe Group. She is married, has three children and lives in the north-east region of Haiti where electricity is rare and portable water is very limited. She has been operating her clothing boutique for the last four years. Prior to this, Isemene was a seamstress. She hopes that this loan will help her grow her business. Other members of her group need loans to support their businesses in food products, soft drinks, etc. Isemene says her main challenge is to grow her business, and her primary goal right now with loans from Esperanza International is to obtain a truck that will help her expand her client base.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Harmonie De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Sainvil est  le coordinateur de son groupe Harmonie de Ouanaminthe. Il est marie et Il a  2 enfants. Il habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou l’électricité est rare et de l'éau portable est très limitée. Il a une boutique de vente de produits divers.

Sainvil espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son business. Il prendra ce prêt pour acheter des vêtements, de cosmétiques et d'autres produits.  Des autres membres de son groupe ont besoin d’un  emprunt pour faire le commerce tel que ventes produits alimentaires, boissons gazeuses,  nourriture, etc. 

Il  dit que son défit  principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans sa vie. Il veut avoir une entreprise stable pour aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Sainvil is the coordinator of the Harmonie De Ouanaminthe Group. He is married, has two children and lives in the north-east region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and portable water is very limited. He has a shop selling various products. 

Sainvil hopes that this loan will help him grow his business. He will use this loan to buy clothes, cosmetics and other products for resale. Other members of his group need loans to support their businesses in food products, soft drinks, etc. Sainvil says his main challenge is to grow his business. He wants to have a stable business to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, cosmetics and other products

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: Marcos de 26 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de gas propano lo cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y ladrillo de barro ya que desea construir una pila con lavadero ya que por el momento no cuenta con una. Espera poder tener acceso a este crédito y así facilitar el resguardo del agua.
texts.en:
Marcos, 26, lives with his wife and 8-year-old son. He has been selling propane gas for two years, which is his main source of income. He earns a living to sustain his household. 

He wishes to improve his living conditions, which is why he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and mud bricks. He would like to build a wash house with a sink because he currently doesn't have one. By receiving this loan, he will increase his ability to store water.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and mud bricks to build a wash house with a sink.

loans.name: Johana Vanessa

texts.es:
Johana de 40 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, crema, cuajada, queso. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no curso una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar como eduacadora. Su mayor sueño es poder brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos plasticos como baldes, pana, tinas, vasos plasticos y  cosméticos como base, marbellines, lápiz labial, rubor, sombra de ojos, anteojeras, antiarrugas, crema hidratantes, body, perfumes. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias, de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos plasticos y cosmeticos  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Johana is 40 years old. She is a single mother responsible for two children. She is originally from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern zone of the country. El Sauce is characterized as being a productive zone for milk, cream, curd cheese, and cheese. She is a very hard-working, responsible woman with a will for personal achievement. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, she did not study for a career, but she would have liked to have studied to be a teacher. Her greatest dream is to offer her children a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her will to advance, she has a business selling plastic products such as buckets, containers, tubs, plastic cups, and cosmestics such as base, Maybelline products, lipstick, blush, eye shadow, eye masks, anti-wrinkle creams, hydrating creams, body lotions, and perfumes. She works in her business some 8 hours a day, as a street vendor and in her home. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business of selling plastics and cosmetics so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income.

loans.use: to stock her business of selling plastic products such as buckets, containers, tubs, and plastic cups, and cosmetics such as Maybelline products, lipstick, blush, eye shadow, eye masks, anti-wrinkle creams, hydrating creams, body lotions, and perfumes.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru: Зайнура молодая женщина. Она заботливая мать 2 детей. Дети еще несовершеннолетние. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. У него не было работы в Таджикистане, и поэтому он был вынужден уехать в Россию, оставив все заботы своей жене. Зайнура одна воспитывает своих детей. Она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Зайнура имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Она откармливает скот у себя дома. Она сама выращивает сено для скота. Зайнура вместе со своими детьми живет в старом доме. Она должна срочно отремонтировать свой дом, так как в ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Зайнура запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zaynura is a young woman.  She is a caring mother of 2 children.  Her children are not yet grown.  Her husband is a migrant laborer in the Russian Federation.  He did not have a job in Tajikistan and was forced to travel to Russia leaving all the cares for his wife.  Zaynura raises her children alone.  She grows crops.  Zaynura has additional income from raising livestock.  She raises livestock in her home.  She grows hay for the livestock herself.  Zaynura and her children live in an old house.  She needs to quickly make repairs to her home, because it is in bad condition.  Zaynura is asking for a loan for the purchase of building materials to repair her home.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials for home repairs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 5 children and describes himself as a good planner as well as an honest and patient person. He operates a farm where he grows crops. Joseph describes his family challenge to be getting water for domestic use. He will use the 11,000 KES loan to buy a 1500 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit five people. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will do agribusiness. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 1500 litre water tank.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 28 years old. She is married with two children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for ten years. With the loan, Grace would like to buy more beans and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 23 years old. She is married with one child aged one. She sells various merchandise and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, and salt for sale. Rachel plans to use the profits for providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and salt for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, age 28, operates a boutique where she sells clothes to earn an income. She describes herself as a creative and innovative person. She and her husband have two children, ages five and seven.

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a 1,500-liter water tank in which to store clean water for domestic use. The tank will benefit five people. 

This will be her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

She hopes for her business to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy a 1,500-liter water tank in which to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina runs a general store business to earn an income. She and her husband have five children. Her husband works as a house builder and they have been in their respective businesses for the past five years. 

With her loan funds, Safina will buy more cooking oil and sugar to offer for sale. The expected profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and sugar to offer for sale

loans.name: Aishagul

texts.ru: Айшагуль 61 год, вдова, сама воспитала 3 детей, а теперь помогает детям и воспитывает внуков. У Айшагуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айшагуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 38 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айшагуль  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,08 ГА, на котором выращивает перец и арбузы. По хозяйству помогают старший сын и внуки. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). Айшагуль  входит в группу "Жаштык", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Айшагуль является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айшагуль  обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айшагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Aishagul is 61 years old, she is a widow, raised 3 children on her own and now helps her children and raises her grandchildren.  Aishagul has a high school education, as a main source of income for her family Aishagul raises livestock.  She started 38 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work today Aishagul has 2 milk cows, 15 sheep and also has a 1.08 hectare plot of land where she grows peppers and watermelon.  Her oldest son and grandsons help her with her holdings.  Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).  Aishagul belongs to a group "Zhashtik," two other people are part of this group.  Aishagul is the third member of the group. In order to further grow her holdings, Aishagul turned to Microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of heifers in order to increase her livestock count.  Aishagul plans to use the proceeds from the loan to further increase her livestock count and plans to save money to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 40 years old and married with four children. She runs a fish business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to strive her daily living. 

Kadiatu has been in this business since just after she got married and sells fish within her community. She says that sometimes she is facing scarcity of fish when the weather condition is poor.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty, age 40, sells fish within her community to earn an income. She lives and works in Tombo, a western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started her business just after she was married, with the goal of meeting the family's everyday survival needs. She and her husband have three children.

She reports that her major hardship is high competition in the market.

Mabinty requested a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more fish to offer for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and will be used for her children's welfare. 

In the future, she would like to build a boat. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu earns an income by selling glasses, cups, knives, and food containers with her community. She started business after she was married because she wanted to improve her family's living conditions. She and her husband have three children. Abibatu is in her late thirties and lives in Tombo, a western rural area of Sierra Leone.  

She reports that the main problem she encounters in her business is that she sells her wares from an inefficient, temporary location.

Abibatu has requested a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more glasses and plates and a variety of food containers to offer for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and build a permanent business structure. 

In the future, she would like to build a fishing boat. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more glasses and plates and a variety of food containers to offer for sale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata sells palm oil within her community to earn her living. She started her business after she was married so as to improve the family's living conditions. She and her husband have three children. Fatmata is in her late thirties and lives in Tombo, a western rural area of Sierra Leone.

She reports that the major obstacle to the success of her business is her slow purchasing power, which makes it difficult to expand her business, as well as transportation costs.

Fatmata has requested a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more palm oil to offer for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and ensure the education of her children. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima, age 38, and her husband Uttam, age 44, live in the small town of Maynaguri in Dhupguri with their three children. All three children are studying. Pratima is a homemaker and her husband is running his own betel nut business. Her husband’s income from his business is insufficient to bear household expenses and the educational expenses of children of their family. 

Pratima decided to start some new business and help her husband in making more profit for her family. She decided to purchase a cow and sell her milk and make dairy products to sell in the local market and have some profit from it. Due to lack of money she was unable to purchase a cow so she applied for a loan. This business will be profitable for them because in that area where there is a great demand for milk and dairy products.

Pratima's future dream is to purchase more cows from the profit of this business and make their family financially strong. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and dairy products in the market.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: María de 37 años de edad habita en casa propia en condiciones muy humildes y sencillas junto a su compañera de vida y sus 6 hijos (18 años, 17 años, 15 años, 5 años, 3 años y 1 año). María trabaja muy duro junto a su esposo para llevar el sustento a sus hijos. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de su localidad. Este negocio le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y ayudar con los gastos. Desea mejorar su cocina la cual se encuentra al aíre libre y el techo se encuentra deteriorado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, ladrillo, arena y cemento para reparar el cuarto de concina lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in her own home in humble and simple conditions. She lives with her husband and six children (ages 18, 17, 15, 5, 3 and 1). Maria works very hard along with her husband to provide for their children. For eight years she has worked selling fruits and vegetables in her local market. This business has allowed her to support her family and help with expenses.

Maria would like to improve her open-air kitchen, the roof of which is in bad condition. She is requesting this loan from the field partner to buy galvanized sheets, bricks, sand and cement to repair her kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, bricks, sand and cement to repair her kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 33 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 17 años, 15 años, 13 años, 11 años y 2 años de edad. Para ella su familia lo es todo y es por ella que trabaja duramente para sacar adelante  a sus hijos. Desea repellar las paredes de su casa para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento. María espera realizar la mejora lo antes posible y así proteger las paredes de su vivienda de la humedad.
texts.en: María is 33 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and children aged 17, 15, 13, 11, and 2 years of age. For her family is everything and this is why she works hard to bring up her children. She wants to plaster the walls of her home which is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of sand and cement. María hopes to make improvements as soon as possible in order to protect the walls of her home from moisture.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement in order to plaster the walls of her home to help protect against moisture.

loans.name: Union  Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” conformada por 08 socios responsables y emprendedores. Jesusa se dedica a la venta de emolientes, actividad que viene siguiendo con el  ejemplo de sus suegros, pues ellos fueron quienes le  enseñaron. Dicho negocio le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la  compra de limón, azúcar, cebada y así poder preparar sus emolientes. Ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente es su mayor anhelo.   Jesusa de 57 años es separada y tiene 03 hijos independientes.  El grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” agradece a las personas hicieron posible este crédito. Jesusa se encuentra en la parte de adelante, es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo morado y falda ploma.
texts.en: This is the “Unión Por El Progreso” (Union For Progress) group. It is made up of eight responsible and enterprising members. Jesusa makes a living by selling moisturisers, which she is continuing due to her in-laws’ example, as they were the ones who taught her. The business has enabled her to improve her home and cover the household expenses. She requested the loan in order to purchase lemon, sugar, and barley so she can make her moisturisers. To see her children have good careers is her greatest desire. 57-year-old Jesusa is separated and has three grown-up children. The “Unión Por El Progreso” group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible. Jesusa is at the front of the picture and is the third from the left side. She is wearing a purple polo and a grey skirt.

loans.use: to purchase lemon, sugar, and barley

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La joven Noemí una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad en la zona  sur de Honduras junto a  sus  hijos. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas como tajaditas, yucas y otro tipos de comidas desde hace varios años, esto lo hace en una glorieta y también vende lugares cercanos a su residencia.
Noemí necesita el préstamo para la compra de plátanos, cebollas, yucas, papas, arroz, carnes, tortillas, sal, refrescos, etc que son la materia prima para elaborar sus golosinas y seguir realizando su actividad la cual forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos y así mismo desea bríndales más  producto a sus clientes ya  que son bastantes y en este momento no cuenta con los recursos necesarios.
Noemí con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten además desea mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia debido al  aumento de los ingresos su sueño es que en un corto plazo su negocio crezca y poder seguir apoyando a su familia y a su hijo.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Noemí's a very hardworking and responsible young person.  She lives with her children in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  For several years her business has been selling snacks.  She sells in a stand and also in the area near her home.

Noemí needs the loan to buy bananas, onions, yuca, potatoes, rice, meat, tortillas, salt, beverages, and so on so she has the ingredients to continue doing her job.  This is the main part of her income and she wants to give her many customers more products, but she doesn't have the necessary resources at the moment.

Noemí hopes her sales will increase because of the loan.  She also hopes the increase in income will improve her family's quality of life somewhat.  Her dream is that her business will grow in the short term and she'll be able to continue supporting her family and her son.

Choluteca, Honduras, October 2013

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, yuca, potatoes, rice, meat, tortillas, salt, beverages, and so on

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Бахринисо всегда старается для благо получения своих детей. Она заботливая мать 4 детей. Бахринисо еще в родительском доме научилась шитью женской одежды. Она сегодня самостоятельно введет свое дело. Бахринисо шьет аккуратно и вовремя предоставляет готовые платья своим заказчикам. Она не имеет другого источника дохода. Она основная кормилица своих детей, так как ее муж не имеет постоянное место работы.  Он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию для того, чтобы найти работу и таким образом зарабатывать на жизнь. Бахринисо должна помочь мужу. Ее муж даже не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Бахринисо запрашивает займ для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahriniso always works hard for the well being of her children.  She is a caring mother of 4 children.  Bahriniso learned to sew women's clothing in her parents' home.  Today she runs her business independently.  Bahriniso sews accurately and presents finished dresses on time to her customers.  She does not have another source of income.  She is the main provider for her children, as her husband does not have a steady place of employment.  He would like to travel to the Russian Federation in order to find work and earn a living.  Bahriniso needs to help her husband.  Her husband does not even have enough money to purchase an airline ticket.  Bahriniso is asking for a loan to purchase and airpline ticket.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an airplane ticket for her husband

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, ella es madres soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Deysi no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Deysi trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de utensilios par el hogar,ella trabaja recorriendo las calles de su ciudad para vender y puede hacerlo todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, Deysi se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Deysi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara utensilios de madera para su venta, tales como mesas, sillas, bancos, camas,otros, así pues, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
Deysi is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her parents and son. She is a hard-working single mother who invests all of her efforts in getting ahead. Unfortunately because of a lack of resources and the need to work, Deysi was not able to study a professional career track. Upon her own initiative, Deysi works in a small store selling products for the home. She goes up and down the streets of the city to sell and works up to ten hours every day.

Deysi is pleased to work and believes that it is going well for her due to her dedication and effort. She is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help brought forth, she will buy wooden utensils to sell, including tables, chairs, benches, bed frames and other items. She will continue working and putting in the effort to achieve her dream of owning a large business.

loans.use: to buy wooden utensils to resell.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moises nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). Moises tiene 53 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermoza relacion tiene tres hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, el tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra plátanos, coca, píña,yucas y maíz. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Moises was born in the city of Salvación and lives in the same city where he was born.  The city of Salvación is located in the Manu district in the province of Manu in the department of Madre de Dios, Peru.  Moises is 53 years old, married, and has three children.  He is a hardworking and enterprising person who moves his family forward.  

He works in agriculture and has plots of farmland where he plants bananas, coconut, pineapple, yucca, and corn.  He has been doing this work for many years and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He is a member of the Las Palmeras del Manu community bank and is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and other items.  He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Innovación  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Innovación está formado por 9 mujeres luchadoras ya que se dedican a trabajar muy duro en diferentes actividades, las mismas que les permiten ser independientes económicamente. Viven por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada de mucha vegetación y amplios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su arquitectura nos transporta al pasado y esta rodeada de cuatro ríos.
Una de las socas de este grupo es la Señora. Cinthya, forma parte del grupo de crédito Innovación desde hace un año y le gusta mucho este tipo de crédito por la amistad que existe entre todas las socias al mismo tiempo que les ayudan a crecer con los créditos que reciben.
La Señora Cinthya tiene 28 años de edad, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres compartiendo los gastos del hogar.
Doña Cinthya trabaja como secretaria de lunes a sábados, también es propietaria de un pequeño taller de costura desde hace 6 años, cuando ella está trabajando su mamá le da administrando y en el tiempo libre o por las noches se dedica a trabajar en su taller.
 Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de telas e repuestos para sus maquinas de coser. Su sueño es tener una fábrica con varios operarios y poder exportar su producción.
texts.en:
The loan group "Innovación" (Innovation) consists of 9 hard-working women who work very hard in different businesses, which allow them to be economically independent. They live in the city of Cuenca. This city is surrounded by much vegetation and ample spaces for enjoying nature. Its architecture carries us back to the past, and it is surrounded by four rivers.

One of the members of this group is Señora Cinthya, who has been part of the loan group "Innovación" for a year. She likes this type of credit very much because of the friendship that exists among all the members, at the same time that it helps them grow with the loans that they receive.

Señora Cinthya is 28 years old. She is separated from her husband, but from her marriage she has two children, ages 10 and 3. Her older son goes to a little city school. She does not have her own house, and so she lives in the house of her parents, sharing the household expenses.

Doña Cinthya works as a secretary from Monday to Saturday. She has also been the owner of a little sewing workshop for 6 years. When she is working, her mother manages the workshop, and in her free time or in the evening she works in her workshop.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of fabrics and parts for her sewing machines. Her dream is to have a factory with a number of operators and be able to export her products.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing machine parts.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Kenyan entrepreneur and non-profit leader. In 1996, John started Sustainable Community Development Services (SCODE), a national NGO that started as a community-based organization with an aim to enable the poor in Kenya to improve their lives by adopting environmentally friendly technologies. SCODE exists to facilitate adoption of clean energy technologies and sustainable land use approaches through capacity building, awareness campaigns, and last-mile product distribution. The organization has an office and community-training center in Kenya. Over the last 17 years, SCODE has established a track record of promoting solar energy, improving management of natural resources, and allowing low-income families to improve both their quality of life and carbon footprint. In 2006, SCODE won the prestigious Energy Globe Award for Sustainable Energy in recognition of its work with small-scale farmers across Western Kenya.

One Degree Solar started working with John in 2011 when introducing its first solar lighting product, during which time One Degree sent a summer intern to work with SCODE and begin developing an SMS tool to help monitor impact. SCODE was a natural partner with years of experience selling solar systems, clean cook stoves, and other life-improving products. SCODE now sells the One Degree BrightBox system, which powers up to four light bulbs, as well as mobile phones and radios. Currently, families spend significant portions of their incomes on kerosene, candles, phone charging services, and toxic dry cell batteries for radios.

SCODE has also developed an innovative Solar Energy Demonstration Project, which is intended to reassure consumers of the reliability of solar technology and to build local capacity for after-sales service. This targeted program helps to demystify the technology, localize it, and encourage more entrepreneurs and families to invest in it. The project trains local electricians on solar PV installation and maintenance, while ensuring end-users have knowledge of proper use and preventative maintenance.

John and his small team have sold over 200 BrightBox systems in the last few months, and they have several potential customers asking for systems without means of affording them. With your help, SCODE will be able to offer BrightBox with extended financing to low-income end-users who want to break the cycle of constantly buying polluting, unhealthy, and unsafe energy.

loans.use: to pay for solar energy systems and offer financing plans to lower-income farmers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce has continued to sell BrightBox to low-income farmers across Western Kenya.  With the help of two previous loans from Kiva lenders, Joyce has been able to offer an installment payment method to many of her customers who were previously unable to afford the clean energy systems at an upfront cost.  We are providing Joyce a higher loan amount to ensure Joyce can continue to offer these payment terms to her customers and meet the overwhelming demand that she has built with the help of Kiva lenders. Thank you!

loans.use: to pay for solar energy systems and offer financing plans to lower-income farmers.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a curious person. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She describes her family challenge to be the lack of a water storage facility. 


She will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a 4000-litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. The tank will benefit five people. 


She hopes that in the future, she will have enough water harvesting facilities. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 4000-litre water tank.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: Luis de 40 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar el cual está constituido por su compañera de vida,  dos hijos y su padre y madre. Desde hace 7 años se dedica al negocio de tienda en la cual ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad y gracias a su carisma y buenos precios muchas personas lo prefieren y le demandan cada vez más. Su deseo es resguardar su vivienda de las corrientes de aguas lluvias ya  que éstas están minando el terreno en donde habitan, por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, hierro y arena para construir un muro de retención y asegurar su terreno de las corrientes de agua cuando llueve.
texts.en:
40-year-old Luis lives in his own home with his family, which is made up of his wife, two children, and his father and mother.  For seven years he has made a living through running a store in which he offers a variety of staple goods, and thanks to his charisma and good prices, many people increasingly prefer and demand his goods.

His wish is to protect his house from the currents of rainwater that are damaging the land where he lives.  This is why he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of cement, brick, iron, and sand in order to build a retaining wall and secure his land against the water currents when it rains.

loans.use: to buy cement, brick, iron, and sand in order to build a retaining wall and secure the land against the water currents when it rains.

loans.name: Hope To God I Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hope To God I” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. The 43-year-old is married to a fisherman and they have five children – two in primary school and three in secondary school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for nine years now. She sells fried cakes, drinks, laundry soap, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy soap making materials, flour, oil, drinks, etc. in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy soap making materials, flour, oil, drinks, etc. in order to boost her business

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is an entrepreneur who works with a small team of socially minded partners to improve the lives of farmers throughout Kenya.  His work involves building market linkages with suppliers of environmentally friendly products that are needed within local communities, and bringing them to areas with little access to these technologies.  Over the last several years, Laban has brought access to sustainable energy and poverty-alleviating products to thousands of farmers who earn a living from growing flowers and raising livestock.  

Laban's product line includes solar energy solutions as well as clean cook stoves, both of which are sold directly on farms and in open-air markets. Through local demonstrations, Laban's team engages local communities in understanding the positive aspects of solar when compared to traditional energy sources such as candles, kerosene, and disposable batteries.  With years of experience selling a variety of solar products, Laban has built a reputation as a trusted reseller in his community.

Laban began working with One Degree’s team in Kenya in 2012 after hearing about BrightBox, a new solar energy kit that powers lights, phones, and radios.   Since September 2012, Laban has already sold over 250 BrightBox systems to his customers.  He already has requests for many more, which he would like to provide before the holidays.  While happy with his initial success, Laban has been selling to farmers on a regular cash basis, while many others cannot afford to pay upfront. These same farmers are often stuck spending $10-$15 per month - a considerable portion of their income - on lighting and phone charging.

To break this cycle and make renewable energy accessible to these customers, Laban would like to start offering flexible payment terms to those who need it most, while also increasing his inventory on hand to serve more customers.  He seeks support from Kiva lenders to make this happen.

Laban will use funds for 50 BrightBoxes, which will be used to energize and empower households across his region. Customers will be able to collect BrightBox systems immediately and pay for them upfront or over several months. Since they are currently spending money on polluting, unsafe, and inefficient energy, most will save enough to recoup costs in 4-5 months and never worry about fuel or fire again. With your help, Laban will help families eliminate energy expenses, improve safety, and allow their children to read into the night.

loans.use: to pay for solar energy systems and offer financing plans to lower-income farmers

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is in her late twenties and married with three children. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo, Western rural area, in Sierra Leone. She started her business because she wants to improve the condition of her family.  


She's been in this business since after she left school. She sells glasses, cups, knives and food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is an improper business location.


Zainab requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more glasses, cups and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and build a permanent business structure. 


In the future, she would like to build a boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more glasses, cups and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es: A sus 44 años de edad María trabaja muy duro para sacar llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. A la fecha se encuentra separada de su esposo  por lo que ella lleva la responsabilidad del hogar. Habita en casa propia junto a su pequeña nieta de 9 años ya que ella le ayuda a  su hija a cuidar la niña. María se caracteriza por ser emprendedora ya que desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida vendiendo antojitos típicos tales como: tamales de pollo y pastelitos de carne. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. En vista de que su terreno se ve afectado por las corrientes de agua cuando llueve desea hacer un muro de retención para evitar que se siga lavando. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento arena y hierro y así comenzar la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
At 44, María works very hard to bring daily sustenance to her home.  To date she is separated from her husband, which is why she carries the responsibility of her household.  She lives in her own house with her little 9-year-old granddaughter because she helps her daughter care for the young girl.  María is known for being enterprising because for a long time she has earned a living selling typical snacks such as chicken tamales and little meat pastries.  In this way she earns a living and supports her household.

Given that her land is affected by water currents when it rains, she wishes to build a retaining wall in order to prevent it from further washing away.  For this, she asks for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron, and thus begin the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron in order to build a retaining wall to protect the land.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: Reyna de 49 Años de edad soltera y con 1 hijo, Reyna se dedica hace  23  años al servicio de costura remalle Reyna  confecciona prendas de vestir, en un pequeño local (alquilado) con el fin de progresar día a día y salir adelante, Reyna   a sabido ganarse a los clientes  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Reyna  solicito el préstamo para comprar confecciones de vestir (telas) la vez  Reyna   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Reyna  esta parada en el medio  y se le distingue con un polo de color celeste,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Reyna is 49 years old, single, and has one son. She has worked for 23 years in the sewing industry. Reyna makes articles of clothing in a small rented space, where her goal is to make progress from one day to the next and to get ahead. She says she has learned how to attract customers and improve her quality of life.

Reyna is requesting this loan to buy fabric to make clothing. She and all of the members of the group are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence that has been given them. Reyna is in the middle of the photograph and is wearing a light-blue shirt. She says that she promises to meet all of her proposed goals.
