loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Jennifer Elieth

texts.es:
Jennifer de 31 años de edad casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Ella en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar trabajo social.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de golosinas como paletas, bombon, caramelos de diferentes sabores chicles, gelatinas, chocolates  Ella dedica a su negocio unas  10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de gosolinas para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. En la foto podemos apreciar las cajas de golosinas. Jennifer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jennifer is 31 years old, married, and has one minor son.  She is originally from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country.  She is hardworking, responsible, and wants to succeed personally.  In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her children and spend quality time with them.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to study a career, but she would have liked to study social work.  Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, she works selling candy such as lollipops, bonbons, caramels of different flavors, gum, gelatines, and chocolates.  She works offering her products for 10 hours a day.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in working capital for buying and selling candy so that in the near future she can earn more income.  In the photo, you can see the boxes of candy.  Jennifer is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders are providing to people with limited resources in Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her business buying and selling candy, such as lollipops, bonbons, caramels of different flavors, gum, gelatines, and chocolates.

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es: Bertha Adilia, es una madre trabajadora que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos y se esfuerza para  mantener los gastos de escuela de ellos, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa cosméticos y calzados por encargo, también los vende en su casa de habitación. Solicita el crédito para abastecer de productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes en el negocio como: pantalones, camisas de damas y caballeros, ropa interior y calzado.  Siendo  su objetivo con esta inversión  mejorar sus condiciones económicas para ella y su familia, Bertha Adilia cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien labora como albañil, pero no devenga un salario fijo, por lo que ella siempre busca la manera de cómo salir adelante y la opción de financiamiento es su mejor salida.
texts.en:
Bertha Adilia is a hardworking mother who cares deeply for her children’s wellbeing and works very hard to pay for their schooling. She works selling clothing, cosmetics and footwear by order, as well as from her home.

Bertha Adilia is requesting this loan to supply her business with products that are most in demand with her customers, such as pants, men’s and women’s shirts, underwear and footwear. Her goal with this investment is to improve her family’s economic conditions. She says that her husband works in construction, but that he does not earn a fixed salary, which is why she is always looking for ways to get ahead. She says that she determined that financing her business was her best option.

loans.use: to buy pants, men’s and women’s shirts, underwear and footwear.

loans.name: Hatun Sayhua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HATUN SAYHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “HATUN SAYHUA” communal bank, located in the Lamay district, part of the Calca province and Cusco department.

Dominga is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children.  She works in her business, raising and selling animals such as Guinea pigs and chickens.  She fattens them up and then sells them at the various fairs and gets her children ahead through this small business.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell Guinea pigs and chickens and she is asking for this loan to buy more animals and feed.

Her picture is added to the group picture because she was not able to attend the photo shoot because of work commitments.

The other members farm, raise livestock, have grocery stores, and sell animals.

She is grateful to those who form part of this dream and she is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Nicolas Leonidas

texts.es: Nicolas habita en la comunidad de san remigio es casado tiene dos hijos, desde muy temprana edad nos dice que el comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades es decir en lo primero que encontrara es por eso  que  hoy en día todo eso que aprendió  le ha servido de mucho pues el no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar  como el hubiera querido pues antes los tiempos eran mas difíciles y se tenia menos acceso a poder ir a la escuela ya que había que ayudarle a sus padres. hoy en día su vida es diferente  ya que es socio de la cooperativa Fuente de vida la que conformaron con un grupo de compañeros de trabajo. Actualmente el tiene su casa propia y un par de manzanas de tierras que ha comprado con el fruto de su trabajo sus hijos estudian y su esposa se dedica  las actividades del hogar , el quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y anhela tener energía en su hogar pero el proyecto que la energiza convencional llegue a la comunidad esta parado , es por eso que esta solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de un sistema  solar el que sera de mucha utilidad en su hogar
texts.en: Nicolas lives in the Community of San Remigio.  He is married and has two children and says that he began working at different activities from an early age; that is whatever he could find, and today everything he learned has helped him because he didn’t have the opportunity to attend school as he would have liked.  At that time it was more difficult and he had less access because he needed to help his parents.  Today his life is different and he is a partner in the “Fountain of Life” co-op that he and some co-workers formed.  He has a home of his own and two plots of land that are the fruits of his labor.  His children attend school and his wife is a home maker.  He wants to improve his family’s living conditions and wants to have electricity in his home, but the plan to bring it to his community is on hold.  He is asking for a loan to buy a solar system that will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy a solar electrical system.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo, Western rural area, in Freetown. She is married with two children. Her children are going to school. 


After she got married, Kadiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week, moving around the community to establish her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.


Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her children’s welfare. 


In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.en: Buenaventura is 62 years old. She is a widow and has two children. She lives in Mitimos, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Buenaventura has engaged in the sewing business for eight years and earns a monthly income of 3,500 (PHP).  Now she has requested a new loan to purchase various raw materials to use for sewing. Buenaventura has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2005. She is really striving to meet their daily needs especially now that she is alone raising her two children, one in grade school and one is in high school.

loans.use: to purchase various raw materials to use for sewing.

loans.name: Raul Carlos

texts.es:
Raul tiene 58 años de edad y vive al lado de su esposa con quien tiene un hijo al cual quiere mucho. Raul es un hombre muy trabajador, es por ello que para poder ganarse la vida y poder llevar sacar adelante a su familia  trabaja como maestro constructor desde hace 5 años; Raul cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable y sobre todo responsable con sus clientes.

Raul esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una pequeña maquina mezcladora con la cual  podrá trabajar mejor y poder brindar un mejor servicio, así podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y comprarse un auto”.
texts.en:
Raul is 58 years old and lives alongside his wife, with whom he has one son who he loves very much.  Raul is a hard-working man. This is why he is able to earn a living and get his family ahead in life.  For five years he has worked as a master builder.  Raul believes that his job is going well because he is kind and, above all else, responsible with his clients.  

Raul is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered he will be able to buy a small mechanic mixer with which he can improve his work and offer better service.  This way he will be able to continue fighting to realize his greatest dream: "To finish building his house and to buy a car."

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: Yabom

texts.en:
Yabom is in her late forties years and married with three children. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo, Western rural area, in Sierra Leone. She started her business because she wants to improve the condition of her family.  



She has been in this business since after she got married. She sells glasses, plates and food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is an improper business location.



Yabom requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more glasses, plates and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and build a permanent business structure. 


In the future, she would like to build a fishing boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more glasses, plates and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es un microempresario cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Alfonso tiene 43 años, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos; él se considera una persona trabajadora y responsable.  

Alfonso es mecánico, arregla ciertos detalles que tengan los autos en general y por otra parte se dedica al manejo de unidades de transporte público. Con este préstamo quiere reparar su vehículo y lo que le reste para mejorar su casa. 

Gracias al trabajo en su negocio ha logrado tener un taxi propio con el que da servicio ocasionalmente y tener una camioneta propia. Aparte de sus negocios como mecánico y taxista se dedica a la cría de puercos; por esto, uno de sus retos y sueño a futuro es tener su granja propia.
texts.en:
Alfonso is an entrepreneur and client of Kubo Financiero. This is his story:

Alfonso is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He considers himself to be a hard-working and responsible person. Alfonso works as an auto mechanic and repairs cars. He also works as a taxi driver. With the support from this loan, Alfonso plans to repair his car and make some improvements to his home with any residual funds. 

Thanks to his hard work and dedication to his jobs, Alfonso has been able to purchase a car and a small truck for use in his taxi business. In addition to his jobs as a mechanic and taxi driver, Alfonso also raises pigs. One of his dreams is to eventually have his own farm.

loans.use: to repair the car he uses for his business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is in her late thirties and married with two children. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since she left school. She sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits in her community. She says that the main problem for her is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Hannah requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 50-year-old woman from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. In 2000, Salamatu established her green vegetable business. She began her business to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fertilizer to expand her green vegetable business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to expand her green vegetable business.

loans.name: Cecilia Teodora

texts.es:
Cecilia tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial y para poder obtener ingresos para poder salir adelante trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de su ciudad, para lo cual trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día; Cecilia cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable y sobre todo responsable y cuidadosa.

Cecilia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder tarrajear la habitación donde vive, así mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”
texts.en:
Cecilia is 21 years old. She lives in the city of Imperial and in order to obtain income so she can get ahead she works as a kitchen helper in a restaurant in the city. She works about 9 hours a day. Cecilia believes that she is doing well in her work because she is very friendly and above all responsible and careful.

Cecilia is grateful to the Kiva loaners as thanks to the help provided she can buy construction supplies in order to plaster the room where she lives, thus improving her quality of life and she can continue struggling to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy supplies so she can plaster the room where she lives.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone. This is 39-year-old Aminata from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with six children. She started this business to take care of her family. 

Aminata runs a food-stand business at home; she sells rice, pure water and cooking season. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Aminata says that the main challenges to her business are the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water and cooking season. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water and cooking season.

loans.name: Stand Strong Group

texts.en:
Rabiatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 32 years ago in Rotifunk village. Rabiatu is married and has one child.  For 10 years now, Rabiatu has been selling slippers, body lotions, baby clothes, etc. Rabiatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to expand her business. She will buy slippers, body lotions, baby clothes, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.
  
This is the first loan that Rabiatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy slippers, body lotions, baby clothes, etc. in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora de 32 años de edad, acompañada (en unión libre) y madre de 2 hijas las cuales la mayor de diez años y la menor de tres. En su familia todos han trabado por muchos años la misma actividad del café ya que es la mayor fuente de ingresos para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar mediante la falta de empleo en su comunidad la cual sabiendo aprovechar y atender de manera correcta las plantaciones las ganancias son prosperas y positivas. El compañero de hogar de Claudia también se dedica a la caficultura especializándose también en la compra de ganado y granos básicos para revender. El terreno que ellos trabajan es propio en el cual tiene una gran variedad de plantación de café la cual es café 90 teniendo cultivada gran parte de este producto por su resistencia a las plagas, y a la roya por lo que su estrategia es la cantidad cultivada que tiene y al final de la cosecha la cantidad de sacos a vender para generar las ganancias esperadas. 
Ella ve como una problemática el incremento de los precios de los diferentes insumos a utilizar para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café por lo que ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, abono 12-24-12, urea, foliares, entre otros que ayudaran a poder cumplir la meta que ella y su pareja se han propuesto para esta temporada. 
Claudia sueña en un futuro ampliar sus tierras cultivando todo el terreno que con mucho esfuerzo ha adquirido para sacar adelante a sus hijas las cuales ella quiere se preparen académicamente para que el día de mañana sean mujeres de provecho y con mucho conocimiento.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hardworking and enterprising woman, 32 years old, accompanied (in a partnership) and mother of 2 daughters. The eldest is 10 years old and the younger one is 3.

Everyone in her family has been working for many years doing the same activity, coffee, since it is the major source of income to cover household necessities due to the lack of employment in her community and to take advantage of the knowledge of tending to the plantation correctly for profits which are prosperous and positive. Claudia’s partner grows coffee too and also specializes in the purchase of cattle and basic grains for resale.

They own the land they work and have a large variety of coffee from the plantation which is 90 percent coffee having cultivated a large part of this product for its resistance to pests, and to rust disease. Their strategy is that the amount grown at the end of the harvest is what they have for the number of bags they need to sell in order to generate the expected earnings.

What she sees as problematic is the increase of prices of various supplies to use to provide assistance for their coffee crops which is why she needs financing in order to buy fertilizer, manure, 12-24-12 fertilizer, urea, foliar applications, among other items to help meet the goal she and her partner have proposed for this season.

Claudia dreams of expanding the farm in the future putting forth a lot of effort cultivating all the land she has acquired in order to raise her daughters whom she wants to be academically prepared for the future when they are knowledgeable women with advantages.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for assistance in growing coffee crops

loans.name: José Jesús

texts.es:
José Jesús es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia: 

José tiene 37 años de casado, 3 hijos de 35, de 33 y de 30 años de edad (todos ellos son independientes) y 9 hermosos nietos; formando una familia que él describe como hermosa. 

Se dedica al transporte público desde hace 45 años, es taxista y lleva mucho tiempo trabajando este giro, trabaja toda la zona o a donde lo lleve el pasajero. Este préstamo lo pide para emplacar su automóvil y así tener todo su negocio en orden. 

Para José Jesús su mayor logro es que sus hijos realizaron sus respectivas carreras: su hija es contadora, uno de sus hijos militar y el otro es sargento; para él esto es un gran orgullo. Su mayor meta a futuro es tener otros 2 taxis.
texts.en:
José Jesús is a customer of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

José has been married for 37 years and has 3 children who are 35, 33, and 30 years old (they are all independent) and he has 9 beautiful grandchildren. He has raised a family he describes as beautiful.

He has been working in public transport for 45 years. He is a taxi driver, and spends a lot of time working this job. He works throughout the zone or wherever he takes the passenger. This loan that he is asking for is to register his license plates and thus have his business in order.

For José Jesús his greatest achievement is that his children reached their professional careers: his daughter is an accountant, one of his sons is a serviceman and the other a sergeant; this makes him very proud. His biggest goal for the future is to have 2 more taxis.

loans.use: to process his license plates and to make improvements to his taxi

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli, quien aparece en la foto con su esposo, es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Araceli tiene 39 años, es casada desde hace 16 años y tiene 2 hijas de 14 y 8 años. Su esposo se llama Marco Antonio y entre los dos manejan su negocio de fabricación de ropa, aunque él es mecánico y ocasionalmente hace trabajos de ese tipo. Vive en una casa rentada desde hace 2 meses, ya que anteriormente vivían con su suegro pero necesitaban un espacio más amplio y decidieron independizarse. 

Iniciaron hace 16 años maquilando ropa deportiva, compartían el taller con su suegro y recientemente han decidimos fabricar las prendas, ya que encontraron una tienda que les compre todo lo que hace. Fabrican ropa dependiendo de la temporada y se surten en el centro de la Ciudad de México.

Pide este préstamo ya que esta temporada del año es fuerte para ella y quiere aprovechar que hay mucho trabajo, para generar mayores ganancias. Gracias al trabajo en su negocio ha logrado comprar sus máquinas y abrir su taller propio. Su reto es comprar una plancha industrial para brindar una mejor calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Araceli, pictured above with her husband, is an entrepreneur and client of Kubo Financiero. This is her story:

Araceli is 39 years old and has been married to her husband, Marco Antonio, for 16 years. Araceli and Marco have two daughters, ages 14 and 8. Together, Araceli and Marco operate a clothing manufacturing business, and Marco also works occasionally on the side as an auto mechanic. This family of four was, until two months ago, living with Marco's father, but they needed more space and a home of their own. Araceli and her family are now renting a house.

Sixteen years ago, Araceli and Marco started a business making sports clothing in a workshop shared with Marco's father. They recently found a store that wants to sell the merchandise they make in their workshop, so they plan to expand the scope of clothing and apparel they manufacture. Araceli and Marco vary the style and type of clothing they make with the changing seasons and sell their products in the center of Mexico City.

With the support from this loan, Araceli and Marco plan to purchase materials to complete client orders. A busy season is coming up, so Araceli and Marco hope to take advantage of increased demand to increase their profits and income. Thanks to their hard work and dedication, they have been able to purchase their own manufacturing machines and open their own workshop. Their goal is to purchase an industrial iron to increase the quality of their products.

loans.use: to purchase materials for completing client orders during the busy season.

loans.name: Believe In God Iii Group

texts.en:
Pictured in the photo are the members of the “Believe In God III” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leone (SLL) each in order to boost their respective businesses in both size and quality. This will lead to to more sales, better profits, and improvement in their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Ibrahim. Ibrahim is 42 years old; he was born in Mile Ninety-one in Northern Sierra Leone but is currently residing in Waterloo, together with his wife and four children. His wife is a trader as well, and his children attend primary and secondary schools. 

Ibrahim sells cigarettes and medicines and has been a businessman for ten years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy more cigarettes and medicines to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy more cigarettes and medicines to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer muy trabajadora, actualmente ella es jubilada, y sus ingresos son pocos para lo cual en ocasiones elabora dulces y los ofrece en su vivienda.

Olga esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá construir una pared de seguridad en su vivienda y de esta manera poder vivir más tranquila y evitar robos en su vivienda, Olga tiene como sueno poder tener una pequeña pastelería.
texts.en:
Olga is very hardworking. She is now retired, but her income is very small, so she makes sweets from time to time that she sells from her home.

Olga says she is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because with their help she will be able to build a security wall in her home to prevent robberies and make her feel safer. She says that her dream is to have a small cake shop.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a security wall in her home.

loans.name: Bertha Maria

texts.es: Doña Bertha tiene 53 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo. Es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. De oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas. Inicio este negocio, por la necesidad de ingresos en su familia. Su papa’ se enferma y al poco tiempo muere su hermana, desde entonces, toma la decisión de poner este negocio para ayudar a su papa’ económicamente. Hasta la fecha cuenta con un negocio prospero. Su meta próxima es incorporar más productos en su local. Solicita el crédito para comprar: gaseosas al por mayor de distintos sabores, galletas, nachos entre otros; con el fin de lograr una amplia oferta de bebidas y de confiterías. Estima que este crédito le será de ayuda ya que lograra crecer un poco más su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es solidificar el negocio mediante una buena clientela y mejores condiciones del local.
texts.en:
Bertha is 53 years old and is a single mother to her son. She is from the city of Granada, and she makes a living operating a convenience store. Bertha sells sweets, snacks and soft drinks at her business in order to generate income to support her family. When her father's health started to decline sharply and her sister died, Bertha decided to start a business to help her father financially. She has done very well with her business, and her goal is to increase the variety of merchandise she offers to her customers. 

With the support from this loan, Bertha plans to purchase merchandise to stock her business, including: cookies, nachos, various flavors of soft drinks in bulk and many other items. She hopes this investment will help her to expand her business and increase overall profits. Her future plan is to grow and strengthen her business and her customer base while also making improvements to the store itself.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, nachos, various flavors of soft drinks in bulk and other items to stock her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Roxana Arely

texts.es:
Roxana es una mujer de 47 años de edad, emprendedora  que ha tenido  mucho  sufrimiento  a lo largo de su vida, ya que desde corta edad le toco trabajar para salir adelante, pues viene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos, sumado a eso, el padre se sus dos hijos los abandono  hace algunos años  y le ha tocado  a ella  y a su hija ingeniárselas para poder vivir.   

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada Americana, en el garaje de su casa desde hace 5 años  y 
Además hace 2 años, sale 3 veces por semana a vender en los pueblos aledaños ropa nueva para dama y niños además de ropa interior, esto con el objetivo de generar ingresos adicionales a los que percibe con la venta en  su casa.  

El préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de mercadería (ropa), con la que surtirá su negocio en esta época navideña en la este comercio toma fuerza, lo que piensa comprar es: 2 cajas de ropa americana usada, 3 fardos de ropa interior para caballero, 3 fardos de ropa interior para dama, 2 docenas de camisas nuevas para dama, 3 paquetes de trajes para niño.

En el futuro próximo,  piensa en seguir apoyando  a su hija  en sus estudios universitarios, ya que estudia una carrera técnica en la ciudad y le faltan 2 años para culminar, es el motivo principal que tiene Roxana para esforzare  y trabajar día a día.
texts.en:
Roxana is 47 years old and is an entrepreneur who has suffered much in her life. She began working at a very young age to help her family get by, and the father of her two children abandoned them a few years ago, leaving her and her children to fend for themselves.

For the past five years, Roxana has run a used American clothing business out of her garage. Two years ago she started traveling to neighboring towns to sell her merchandise in hopes of increasing her overall income and profits from the business. She sells women's and children's clothing, as well as underwear. 

With the support from this loan, Roxana plans to purchase used clothing to stock her business and take advantage of the upcoming Christmas season and increased demand for gifts. Specifically, she plans to purchase: 2 boxes of used American clothing, 3 large packets of men's underwear, 3 large packets of women's underwear, 2 dozen new women's shirts and 3 packets of children's clothing. 

Roxana's future goals are to continue supporting her daughter, who is 2 years away from receiving a technical degree at the university in the city. Roxana loves her daughter and works very hard day in and day out to support her in all her endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing) to stock her business.

loans.name: Nuridin

texts.ru:
Нуридин живет в селе района Фархон. Ему 48 лет. Нуридин женат. У него четверо детей. Двое сыновей и две дочки. Старший сын Нуридина работает строителем в Российской Федерации и каждый месяц он высылает своим родителем по 200$. Младший сын Нуриддина учится в школе и помогает отцу по работе. 
    Нуридин на протяжении многих лет работает в сфере растениеводства, выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Он хочет параллельно заняться скотоводством. Многие жители Таджикистана выбирают деятельности животноводства и растениеводства, причина в том, что чистый воздух и необычайная природа республики позволяет начать и развивать бизнес в этой сфере деятельности. Нуридин решил взять на свои плечи оба деятельности. 
    Деятельность скотоводство требует много сил и средств. Нуридин не боится трудностей, и ему будет помогать его сын. Средства у Нуридина имеется, но их не достаточно, чтобы купить несколько голов скота для начала бизнеса. Поэтому Нуридин берет кредит. Он надеется, что ему обязательно помогут. Ведь, мир не без добрых людей.
texts.en:
Nuridin lives in a village in the Farkhor area.  He is 48 years old.  Nuridin is married.  He has four children.  Two sons and two daughters.  Nuridin's oldest son works as a construction worker in the Russian Federation and every month sends his parents $200.  Nuridin's younger son studies in school and helps his father.

Nuridin has been a farmer for many years, he grows crops.  In parallel, he would like to start raising livestock.  Many residents of Tajikistan chose farming and livestock businesses, because clean air and extraordinary nature in the republic allow people to start businesses in this area.  Nuridin decided to take both lines of business on his shoulders.

The livestock business requires a lot of strength and funds.  Nuridin is not afraid of difficulties and his son will help him.  Nuridin has funds, but not enough to purchase several heads of livestock to start his business.  This is why Nuridin is taking out a loan.  He hopes that he will get help, since the world is not without kind people.

loans.use: to start a new business and to buy several heads of livestock

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Emma is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Emma was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, 38 years ago. She is married and the couple has one child who is attending primary school. For the past four years, Emma has had a business selling plastic bowls, buckets, dishes, cups, plates, etc.

With the help of this loan, Emma and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Emma will use her share of the loan (800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy plastic bowls, buckets, dishes, cups, plates, etc. in larger quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, buckets, dishes, cups, plates, etc. in larger quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Julius is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. He was born in Kono 37 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has three children – two in secondary school and one in primary school. For six years now, Julius has been running a small shop where he recharges mobile phone batteries for a fee of 1,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL), cuts men's hair and shaves or trims beards, and sells plastic water bottles.  

Julius and his groupmates are requesting a loan of 800,000 SLL for each member in order to boost their respective businesses. Julius is going to use his share to buy chargers and other electrical equipment, barbering tools, and drinks to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy chargers and other electrical equipment, barbering tools, and drinks to boost his business.

loans.name: Sophanna

texts.en:
Sophanna is 48 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working as a chef for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 5 daily. Three of her children are employed. They are hotel staff, a soldier and a bus ticket seller. They earn about USD 12 each day to help cover the family’s expenses. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sophanna is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to buy a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the transportation expense. 

In the future, she would like to run a laundry shop and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. In addition, she wants to build a new bigger house because she has an extensive family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Lyvang

texts.en:
Lyvang is 30 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and meat balls for more than five years, earning approximately USD 20 per day.

Her husband is a tuk-tuk taxi driver who makes an income of USD 7 each day. His present tuk-tuk (an auto rickshaw) is old and broken too often. Lyvang is requesting a loan of USD 1,300 to purchase a new tuk-tuk. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income because he won't  need to pay for tuk-tuk repairs as often as before. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she wants to complete her house construction.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk-tuk for her husband

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 40 years old and married with three children. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, Western rural area, in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since after the rebel war. She sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Hannah from Waterloo2, in the Eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children. In 2009, Hannah established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand.

Hannah requires a loan in order to purchase more fertilizer to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Hannah plans to expand her business in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to expand her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Sarah from Waterloo2, in the Eastern area of Freetown. She is married and blessed with one child.  She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. In 2007, Sarah established her retail business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Sarah requires a loan in order to purchase more fresh eggs to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Sarah plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh eggs to expand her business.

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru: Гулизор замужем. Она вместе со своим мужем и детьми живет в сельской местности. Она более 16 лет работает уборщицей в государственном учреждении. Гулизор получает маленькую зарплату. Ее зарплата хватает лишь для покупки продуктов питания. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Гулизор старается улучшить условию проживания для своих детей, но ее муж не отправляет денег. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свою квартиру. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов. Она надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulizor is married.  Together with her husband and children she lives in a rural area.  She has been working as a janitor for more than 16 years in a government agency.  Gulizor earns a small salary.  Her salary only covers groceries.  Her husband is a migrant laborer in the Russian Federation.  Gulizor tries to improve the living conditions for her children, but her husband does not send money.  She has been planning to repair her apartment for several years.  With this goal she has applied for a loan.  She is asking for a loan to purchase building materials.  She hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her flat

loans.name: Akbarjon

texts.ru: Акбарджон трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он не женат и является студентом 4 курса. Он учится в Таджикском Государственном Университете. Акбарджон учится отлично и хорошо. Он начитанный молодой человек и всегда в поиске новшества. Он помогает маме по садоводству. Акбарджон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. В будущем он мечтает стать хорошим специалистом.
texts.en: Akbarjon is a hardworking and honest person.  He is not married and is a 4th year student.  He studies at the Tajikistan State University.  Akbarjon is an excellent and good student.  He is a well read young man and always searches for something new.  He helps his mother with gardening.  Akbarjon needs to pay for his student contract, but does not have money.  He is asking for a loan to pay his tuition.  He is waiting for you kindness and hopes for your support.  In the future he would like to become a good expert.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is 33 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia.

She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $5 each day.

Due to lack of funds, Leng is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase dirt to build up her land. This purchase will help prevent flooding at her house. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to build up her land

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora que se ha dedicado toda su vida al trabajo del hogar y hace 10 años a la venta ambulante de tamales, ella por razones culturales no pudo  realizar ningún estudio y esto le ha presentado grandes dificultades en su vida, pero nunca se ha detenido siempre ha tenido  la fuerza para salir  adelante, está acompañada, con quien han procreado 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 están bajo su cargo, 2 aún viven con ellos; pero ya están acompañados  y tiene hijos.  

Desde hace 10 años inicio con la venta de tamales de elote, en la temporada de elotes. Pero al ver que fue ganando clientela se empeñó a diversificar  la clase de tamales haciéndolos de gallina, pisques y de pato, la  venta la realiza  todos los días de la semana saliendo  de su casa a las  4 de la tarde y camina al lado de su hijo menor, quien le ayuda con la carga, por todas las colonias de regresando  a las 8 pm a su vivienda.

El Préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de materia prima y así incrementar la producción como: maíz, verduras, un recipiente grande para transportar los tamales.   

En el futuro planea, incrementar su producción y además tener un local propio en el centro de la ciudad, para vender sus tamales  y no  vender de forma ambulante, ya que con el pasar de los años está mas cansada y prefiere venderlos  en un local.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and very enterprising. She has worked her whole life in the home, but she has also worked the last ten years selling tamales from place to place. María says that for cultural reasons she was not able to pursue studies, and that this has presented her with some great difficulties in life. However, she says that she has never wasted time and has always had the strength to get ahead. She is married and has five children, three of whom are still under her responsibility. Two of her children are already married and have their own children, but still live with María and her husband.

María started her tamale business ten years ago, selling corn tamales when corn was in season. Upon seeing the number of customers she was attracting, she worked hard to diversify the kinds of tamales she was selling, making tamales with chicken, with black beans and with duck. María sells her tamales every day of the week. She leaves home every day at 4 p.m. with her youngest son, who helps her carry the tamales. They walk through all of the local communities, returning home at 8 p.m.

María is requesting this loan to buy ingredients such as corn and vegetables, and to buy a large container for transporting tamales. She hopes with these she will be able to increase her production.

For the future, María hopes to increase her production and to have her own space in the center of the city from which to sell her tamales, instead of selling them from place to place. She says that with the passing years, she is more tired, and that she would prefer to sell her tamales from a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn and vegetables, and to buy a large container for transporting tamales.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Meet Nancy. She is a 25-year-old from Waterloo2, in the Eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children.  In 2008, Nancy established her cow milk business. She did not go to school, so she was trained with business.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Nancy requires a loan in order to purchase fresher cow milk to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to attend adult education school and increase her business. In the future, Nancy plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fresher cow milk to expand her business.

loans.name: Marizabel

texts.en: Marizabel dreams of becoming a chef. To achieve her goal, Marizabel has enrolled in the Instituto Helen. She plans to graduate but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With the loan, Marizabel plans to spend the money towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Marizabel hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. Marizabel currently works 25 hours a week but making time to work and go to school has been one of her biggest challenges. At her job, Marizabel earns $4 a day but with a degree in culinary arts, she expects to earn $15 a day. Marizabel's parents were never able to complete their primary education and for her family, finances were always tight. With seven older siblings, Marizabel is unsure how she will be able to afford her school books on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Marizabel's father works as a security guard and his salary is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for school books

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 60 years old and widowed with eight children, one of whom is in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. She has requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Misael

texts.en:
Misael is a dairy farmer and artisanal ice cream producer who calls the high plains of Tlaxcala home. 

He's currently spending too much money on the propane required to heat the milk produced by his cows for pasteurization. His 16 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow him to use the abundant cow manure on-site to replace the propane.  The digester will transform the "waste" into two important resources: methane-rich, renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer. 

Misael will use the biogas to heat his milk and also domestically for cooking and heating bathwater. The biofertilizer will increase yields on his forage crops without him having to resort to expensive, petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. 

This loan represents 52% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 59 years old and the widowed mother of three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been raising pigs for 15 years, and she also earns income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Salaymatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salaymatu was born in Eastern Sierra Leone 41 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. 

For over ten years now, Salaymatu has been selling soft drinks, rum, etc. This is the first loan that Salaymatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Salaymatu will use her share of the loan, 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL), to expand her business; she will buy crates of soft drinks, rums, and other drinks to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy crates of soft drinks, rums, and other drinks to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel, 44, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Rome and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Raquel maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.
Raquel dreams to have her own stall and hopes to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business

loans.name: Savoen

texts.en:
Savoen (pictured with her grandson) is 64 years old. She is married and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

She has been cultivating vegetables and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $5 each day. Her daughter is a garment worker and makes an income of $4 daily.

Savoen asks for a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds to cultivate in the dry season. In the future, she wants to purchase a harvester for rental to make more money.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds to cultivate in the dry season

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day.

To improve his livelihood, Pov asks for a loan of $500 to purchase tools for fishing. This purchase will help him generate more income. In the future, he would like to build up his land to prevent flooding.

loans.use: to purchase tools for fishing

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy more computers and other supplies needed in his computer shop. His loan is also helpful in the education of his children. The income from his business is supporting their everyday household expenditures. 

Aside from his computer shop, Luis also has a coin-operated water dispenser for additional income. 
 
Luis would like to apply for another loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Luis hopes to have a bigger computer shop and dreams of giving his family a good future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Arlaine

texts.en:
This is Arlaine. She previously received a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that she used buy wedding gowns, barong tagalog, mothers' dresses, and other ready-to-wear products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan in order to buy more wedding gowns, barong tagalog, mothers' dresses and other ready-to-wear products. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arlaine hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and she dreams of having a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for wedding gowns, barong tagalog, mothers' dresses and other ready-to-wear products.

loans.name: Ma. Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 63-years-old and a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 28,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lolita dreams to open more businesses and hopes that her family will always be in good condition.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand the product inventory of her retail store.

loans.name: Mairamkan

texts.ru: Майрамкан 49 лет, вдова, одна воспитала 4 детей. Получает пенсию по потере кормильца в сумме 3,300 сом (KGS)ежемесячно. Майрамкан имеет средне-специальное образование. После окончания школы, закончила курсы швеи. Проработала в качестве портнихи в разных швейных фабриках. На сегодняшний день работает в частном швейном цеху швеей -технологом, параллельно занимается сельским хозяйством. Начиная с 1994 годов, получив земельный надел начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Майрамкан начала это дело с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,60 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль и картофель. В зимний период реализует молоко. По хозяйству помогают все дети. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,700 сом (KGS). Майрамкан входит в группу "Зета-2", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. Майрамкан является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Майрамкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Mairamkan is 49 years old, she is a widow and raised 4 children alone.  She receives a pension due to the loss of the main provider of 3,300 som (KGS) per month.  Mairamkan has a vocational education.  After finishing school, she finished a seamstress course.  She worked as a seamstress at different sewing plants.  Today she works at a private sewing plant as a seamstress-technologist, at the same time she works in agriculture.  Starting in 1994, having received a plot of land she started working in agriculture.  Mairamkan started this business with 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Mairamkan's hard work, today her holdings include 1 dairy cow, 10 sheep, and also a 1.60 hectare plot where she grows beans and potatoes.  In the winter she sells milk.  Her children help her with her holdings.  Her monthly income is 5,700 som (KGS).  Mairamkan belongs to group "Theta-2," this group has 2 other people.  In total there are three of them.  Mairamkan is the group leader.  In order to further grow her business Mairamkan turned to Microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep to increase her livestock count.  Mairamkan plans to invest her earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock count and plans to save money to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Abdanbek

texts.ru: Абданбеку 64 года, женат, вместе с супругой воспитали 4 детей. Все дети взрослые. Родители гордятся своими детьми, так как воспитали достойных людей. Об Абданбеке и его семье очень тепло отзываются жители его села, где он проживает вместе со своей семьей. Абданбек как человек- очень ответственный, хороший муж и любящий отец. У Абданбека - среднее образование, на данный момент он на пенсии, но несмотря на это продолжает работать охранником посменно. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Абданбек занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Абданбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец, а также имеет небольшой сад, с которого ежегодно получает богатый и насыщенный урожай в виде: клубники, малины и яблок разных сортов. Не каждый может выращивать такие плоды и ягоды, там нужен особый уход. Абданбек с большим вниманием и любовью занимается выращиванием этих ягод и фруктов, поэтому и урожай у него всегда отменный. Также имеет земельный надел размером 1,08 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль и картофель. Абданбеку в хозяйстве активно помогают дети и супруга. Семья очень дружная и трудолюбивая. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Абданбек входит в группу "Зета-2", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Абданбек является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Абданбек обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Абданбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадьбы младшего сына.
texts.en:
Abdanbek is 64 and married with four adult children. The parents are proud of their children, as they grew up to be good people. The residents of the village where Abdanbek and his family live speak very warmly about them. He is a very responsible person, a good husband and a loving father. Abdanbek has a high school education and is currently on a pension, but despite that continues to work shifts as a guard. 

To earn extra income for his family, Abdanbek works in animal husbandry, a business he began 30 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 1,000 KGS. Thanks to his hard work, his holding now contains one milk cow and 10 sheep as well as a small plot from which he receives a rich annual harvest of produce including strawberries, raspberries and various types of apple. Not everyone can raise such fruits and berries - they need special care. Abdanbek takes care of these berries and fruits with great attention and love, and therefore his harvest is always excellent. He also has 1.08 hectares of agricultural land on which he grows beans and potatoes.

Abdanbek's children and wife actively help him on the land. The family is happy and hardworking. Their monthly income is 15,000 KGS. Abdanbek is the second member of three in the group Zeta-2. With the goal of further developing his business, Abdanbek has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase sheep to increase his head count. He plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of his herd, and to save up for his youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 50 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, noodles, and other groceries. She has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old, a married mother with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosalie has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a 40-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a farmer who has managed to grow cotton. He has a medicine shop for additional income. Like other farmers, Benjamin is faced with the problem of weather changes, especially the floods that destroy his crops leading to low production. His dream is to expand his business into bigger markets. Benjamin is requesting a loan to pay his workers.

loans.use: to pay his workers

loans.name: Rommel Daniel

texts.es: Rommel tiene 34 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada, Casado y padre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de calzado. Inicio con una pequeña crianza de cerdos, cuando iba a unos de los mercados de esta ciudad a comprarle la comida de sus animales, de ahí se le da la idea de tener propio negocio. Poco a poco fue vendiendo sus cerdos, el cual con las ganancias obtenidas iba comprando lo necesario para poner su negocio. Hoy en día cuenta con un gran negocio de venta de calzado muy variado. Su meta próxima es tener una línea de calzado solo para mujeres, debido a la alta demanda de estos tipo de calzado. Solicita el crédito para comprar: sandalias, zapatillas, todo tipo de calzado, con el fin de aumentar la oferta de zapatos nuevos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas y podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es seguir ampliando la línea de calzado.
texts.en:
Rommel is 34 years old and is from the city of Granada.  He is married and is the father of two children.  He is a merchant by trade and makes a living selling footwear.  He started with a small pig farm, and when he went to one of the markets in the city to buy feed for his animals it gave him the idea to open his own business.  Little by little he sold his pigs, and with the profits he went on buying what was needed to open his business.  Today he has a great business selling an assortment of footwear.  His next goal is to get a line of shoes only for women, due to the high demand for this type of footwear.  

He asks for the loan in order to buy sandals, sneakers, and all kinds of footwear, with the purpose of increasing his supply of new shoes.  He believes the loan will be very helpful since it will increase his sales and he will be able to fulfill the demand of his customers.  His future plan is to continue expanding the line of footwear.

loans.use: to buy sandals, sneakers, and all kinds of footwear.

loans.name: Henry Wolfran

texts.en: Henry wants to become an accountant. Henry was accepted into the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés and now, with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording the cost of his school books. He plans to graduate in March 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With a loan, Henry plans to purchase his much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Henry feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. To help pay for his expenses Henry currently works 30 hours a week. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With this loan, Henry will be able to focus more on his classes and his future. Henry is looking forward to a career in public accounting and finance and he expects to earn $13 a day. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Henry is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo, a farmer from the Tlaxcalan high plains, knows the value of organic farming and already composts as much of the animal waste on his farm as possible. When he found out about Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters, he felt that they could offer a perfect complement to his current organic-oriented farming practices and, as a result, he has decided to invest in his own six-cubic-meter system. He will use some of the manure from his dairy cows to feed the digester in order to produce rich biofertilizer and renewable biogas. The biofertilizer will complement the compost he already produces and applies and the biogas will displace expensive, fossil-fuel based propane which his family currently uses to cook and heat bathwater. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy different flower decor and supplies needed in her business. Her income from the business is very helpful in meeting their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are helping each other in providing for their family.

She would like to apply for another loan in the amount of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She will use the loan to buy additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elsa dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her whole family will be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants needed in her business.

loans.name: Dignora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dignora, está dispuesta a aprovechar las fechas de fin de año para surtir de nueva mercadería su negocio, con el capital comprara ropa interior ambos sexos, con lo que espera seguir teniendo satisfechos  a sus clientes, con el préstamo anterior ella incremento sus ventas sus ganancias fueron mejores, y pudo cancelar las cuotas mes a mes.
Dignora ha tenido la oportunidad de cambiar la forma de vida familiar, hoy en día tienen mejor alimentación, y su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Dignora is ready to take advantage of end-of-year dates in order to stock up her business with new merchandise.  She will use the loan to buy underwear for both sexes, with which she hopes to continue having satisfied customers.  

With the previous loan she increased her sales, her earnings were better, and she was able to pay the month to month fees.  Dignora has had the opportunity to change her family's life; today they have better food and her family is very healthy.

loans.use: to buy underwear for both sexes.

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en:
Yokonia is a 45-year-old married man with ten children living in Kasese, Uganda. For eight years he has been selling shoes. He has been successful in this business and has managed to raise money to construct rental housing, although they are not yet complete and providing additional income. Yokonia started business in order to be rich and educate his children. His dream is to educate his children to university level and finish his rentals. However, his challenge is the prevailing price fluctuations that hinder his income expectations. 

Yokonia needs a loan to buy shoes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Nanyonga

texts.en:
Nanyonga is a 35-year-old single mother living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a retail shop of second-hand clothes as her main source of income but also farms as her side income. It is from this business that she has been able to educate her children and provide them with all the basic needs. Nanyonga faces a challenge of high taxes levied on second-hand clothes. Her dream is to have a standard boutique in Kamwenge town.

Nanyonga is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nelson Rene

texts.es: Nelson, es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, tiene 33 años de edad. Casado, padre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la barbería. Hace 2 años inicio su negocio en condiciones remotas con sus propios recursos y mucho esfuerzo. Su meta próxima es ampliar su barbería y construir otra en la misma zona de la ciudad para captar a más clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: máquinas para rasurar: tijeras, talco, brochas, comprar recargas para vender, entre otros, con el fin de atraer un nivel más alto de clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudará abrir una segunda barbería así aumentando sus ingresos. Su plan para el futuro es seguir satisfaciendo las demandas de sus clientes y crecer su negocio para brindarles más condiciones.
texts.en:
Nelson is a native of the city of Estelí and is 33 years old. He is married and has one son. He is a businessperson by trade, and operates a barbershop. He started his business two years ago in difficult conditions, with his own resources and a lot of effort. His immediate goal is to expand his barbershop and to build another one in the same area of the city in order to gain more customers.

Nelson is requesting this loan to buy mechanical clippers, scissors, talcum, shaving brushes and product refills to offer for sale, among others. His goal is to attract a higher level of customer. He says that the loan will help him open a second barbershop and therefore increase his income. His plans for the future are to continue meeting his customers’ needs, and to grow his business in order to offer his customers more services.

loans.use: to buy mechanical clippers, scissors, talcum, shaving brushes and product refills to offer for sale, among others.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.en: Luis has always dreamt of becoming a lawyer. Luis is currently attending the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho, working towards his degree in law. He plans to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Luis plans on purchasing his much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Luis feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. To help pay for his school and living expenses, Luis currently works 40 hours a week and earns $5 a day. With a full work schedule and his law school classes, making time to study without textbooks of his own has been a constant challenge. With a degree in law, he expects to earn $30 a day. Luis has three older siblings attending college already and is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Yacqueline Gabriela

texts.en: Yacqueline dreams of becoming a computer engineer but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Yacqueline was accepted into the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording her school expenses. With this loan, Yacqueline plans to spend the money towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Yacqueline hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. Yacqueline currently works 40 hours a week but making time for her secretary position, her classes, and the time required for studying, Yacqueline is stretched thin. Currently, Yacqueline earns $5 a day but with a degree in computer engineering, she expects to earn $30 a day. Yacqueline's father's salary from his job as an auditor is the family's primary source of income. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Yacqueline is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Jorge está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Itá, quienes han visto una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias por medio de su trabajo en conjunto. 
La Sra. Ysidora es una de las integrantes quien tiene una despensa. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo y con  la ayuda de las capacitaciones que está recibiendo, está pudiendo usar de una mejor manera los ingresos, pudiendo administrarlos y aplicando todo lo que aprendió.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de leches, aceite, fideos, arroz, entre otros productos de uso familiar que ella comercializa en su despensa.
texts.en:
The group "San Jorge" is in its second loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. All of the members are friends and neighbors from the city of Itá. By working together, they see this as a great opportunity for themselves and their families.

Sra. Ysidora is one of the members who manages a food pantry.
