Through her effort and work, and with the help of the training she has received, Ysidora is able to better manage her income and apply all of the knowledge that she has learned. She is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, oil, noodles, rice, and other household products that she can sell at her food pantry.

loans.use: to buy milk, oil, noodles, rice, and other household products to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes de 44 años de edad, madre soltera, con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país.  Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación persona en sus ratos libre le gusta pasar tiempo de calidad con su familia, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad.  En la actualidad, sigue luchando para proporcionarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor

Gracias  a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, sal, fósforos, tiste, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener  mejores ingresos. Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 years old and is a single mother to her two children. She is from the town of Sauce, which is located in the northern region of the country. Mercedes is known to be a hard-working, responsible person who is dedicated her work and family. In her free time, she likes to spend quality time with her family. Unfortunately, since she had to work from a very young age to help her family make ends meet, Mercedes was unable to pursue a higher education degree. In light of the opportunities she never had, Mercedes works as hard as she can every day to give her children a brighter future.

With lots of hard work and dedication, Mercedes was able to start a small general store where she works 12 hours every day selling food items in small quantities, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, salt, eggs, juices, soft drinks, detergent, matches and other items. With the support from this loan, Mercedes plans to purchase merchandise to stock her store. She hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business and increase her overall profits and income. Mercedes is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her general store, including: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, salt, eggs, juices, soft drinks, detergent, matches and other items.

loans.name: Flavio Jose

texts.es:
Flavio de 51 años de edad,  casado padre de dos hijos, menores de edad y que están estudiando, es  originario de Somotillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del  país,  se caracteriza por ser emprendedor, trabajador, con principio moral, religioso, con ganas de superación personal. En se desempeña en su negocio desde muy joven, ya que lo aprendió por sus padres el cual desempeñaba el mismo oficio.  En la actualidad lucha por brindarle a sus hijos un futuro mejor

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad el servicio de panadería, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación. Ofreciendo pan de diferentes tipos como rin, tortas de pasas, cachos, semitas, pudin, picos, torta de pinas, empanadas, ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos,el objetivo del credito es invertir en la compra de materia prima como harina, azucar, leche, levadura, huevos, aceite para la elaboracion y venta del mismo, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Flavio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Flavio is 51 years old. He is a married father of 2 young children that are studying. He is originally from Somotillo, a place that is located in the northern zone of the country. He is characterized for being an entrepreneur and a worker with moral and religious principal, with aspirations of personal improvement. He was employed in his business from a young age, as he learned from his parents that were in the same trade. Today he struggles to provide a better future for his children.
 
Thanks to his determination and desire to move forward, he runs a bakery from his place of residence, offering bread of different types like rin, raisin cake, croissants, rolls, pudding, pastries, pineapple cake, and empanadas. He works at his business some 12 hours daily offering his products. The goal of the credit is to invest in the purchase of raw material like flour, sugar, milk, yeast, eggs, and oil for the making and sale of products so that in the not too distant future he will be able to obtain better income. Flavio is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors are providing to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, to have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to invest working capital in the purchase of raw materials like flour, sugar, milk, yeast, eggs, and oil for the production of bread.

loans.name: Lomas Del Sur Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento LOMAS DEL SUR, está compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres,  todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Mayer, tiene 29 casada con tres hijos de 10, 9 y 3 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo,  ella vende visitando instituciones públicas y privada mercados de la ciudad ofreciendo su productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Mayer va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de cosméticos  al por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fiestas de fin de año,  la señora Mayer va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder abastecerse  de variedad de  producto ya que tiene mucha venta y poder tener una tienda donde también pueda ofrecer estos productos  para así tener más ingresos económicos, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia y también poder pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The lending bank Lomas del Sur is made up of 8 members, all women, who all have different trades. The president of the bank is Mayer, 29, married with three children ages 10, 9 and 3. She sells cosmetics from a catalog, going to different public and private businesses in the city offering her products.

This loan is her first with the institution. Mayer will use it to buy cosmetics at wholesale because she has a lot of orders for the end-of-year festivities. Mayer will use the profits to keep improving her business. Her goal is to be able to stock a variety of products so that she has a lot of sales and can also have her own store where she can make more money. She is grateful for this opportunity to be presented with a loan, since this business is the only way that she is able to maintain her family and also pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es: Rómulo continua dedicándose a brindar servicio de transportes, a la agricultura, al engorde de ganado, a la elaboración de artesanía y a la crianza de animales menores, él sigue teniendo sus terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más, el está contento de participar del banco comunal y le ayuda hacer una  persona responsable entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rómulo continues to make a living though offering transportation service, agriculture, fattening cattle, doing craftwork, and raising small animals.  He still has his land where he grows potatoes, barley, corn, oca (a type of tuber), and other things.  He is happy to participate in the communal bank and it helps him be a responsible person.  

At this time, he needs the loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds.  He is grateful to everyone for the loan, therefore he promises to to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Victor Giovanni

texts.es:
Victor vive en la ciudad de chincha, cada día sale a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo  como asistente de almacén, ya que es padre de un pequeño de 2 años al cual quiere mucho y por el cual sale adelante cada día con mucho esfuerzo.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción y podrá realizar mejorar el techo de su vivienda y pintar las paredes de la vivienda donde habita, así podrá mejorar la calidad de su familia y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the city of Chincha, and goes to work as a store assistant each day with a great deal of enthusiasm. He is the father of the small two-year-old whom he loves and for whom he is succeeding each day with much effort.

Victor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have offered him he will be able to buy construction materials and be able to do improvements to the roof of his home and paint the walls of his house. This way he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have my own home."

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá Group

texts.es: Doña Nurian es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá esta mujer indígena de 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos menores de edad y 2 estudian en primaria y secundaria.  Ella y su familia cuentan con un pequeño terreno donde su esposo siembra plátano y ella se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos, está es la manera en que ambos cubren los gastos de la familia. Los ingresos son muy pocos, pero ellos han logrado salir adelante gracias a los préstamos de Fundación Mujer, está es su quinta solicitud de crédito y el nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, concentrado, vitaminas, así como materiales para mejorar las condiciones de los gallineros. Doña Nurian es una mujer muy trabajadora y sus objetivos, son reparar su casa que está en muy malo estado, y también seguir ayudando con los estudios de sus hijos. Junto a ella están 5 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en: Doña Nurian is president of the communal bank "Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá" (Jehovah Will Provide Women's Bank).  She is a 38-year old indigenous woman who is married and has four children.  Three of her children are dependent and two of them go to school, primary and secondary school respectively.  Doña Nurian and her family have a small plot of land on which her husband plants bananas and she raises chickens and pigs.  This is how the two of them cover the family's expenses.  Their income is very small, but they have been able to get ahead thanks to the loans from Fundación Mujer.  This is doña Nurian's fifth loan request, and she is going to invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens, condensed meal and vitamins as well as materials for improving the condition of the chicken coops.  Doña Nurian is a very hard-working woman.  Her objectives are to make repairs to her house, which is in bad shape, and also to continue supporting her children in their educations.  There are five more members of the communal bank doña Nurian belongs to.  They will also invest in agricultural and livestock-related businesses.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, condensed meal, animal feed, vitamins and material to make improvements to the chicken coops.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose tiene 29 años y vive en la ciudad de chincha, el es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, logro estudiar la carrera técnica de computación e informática;  es por ello que trabaja en un traga monedas de su ciudad como operador y con este trabajo puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá estudiar un curso de especialización en computación e informática, lo cual el permitirá poder conseguir un mejor empleo más adelante y luchar para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en: Jose, 29, lives in the city of Chincha. He is a young man with a great desire to get ahead. He studied computer science and informatics, and now works in an arcade in his town as an operator. The job gives him income to move forward. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to take a specialization course in computer science and informatics which will allow him to get a better job in the future and work to realize his biggest dream, owning a home.

loans.use: to pay for specialized training in computer science and informatics.

loans.name: Martha Haydee

texts.es:
Martha, está casada, tiene un hijo, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo, se dedica a vender conchas, jaibas, mariscos y pescado, es un oficio que desempeñaba junto a sus padres, pero cuando formo su propia familia empezó hacerlo por su cuenta. 
Con el crédito compra variedad de pescado, conchas, moluscos, camarones, jaibas, entre otros, al contar con todos estos productos espera tener un negocio más amplio, tener un aumento en sus ventas, tener más clientes, cancelar deudas y tener más ingresos disponibles para invertirlos en los gastos de su familia.
Sueña con tener una mejor economía que le permita instalar su propio local en el mercado para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is married, has a son, and lives with her husband and son. She sells clams, crab, seafood and fish. This is an occupation she used to engage in with her parents, but when she formed her own family she began to do it on her own account. 

With the loan, she is buying a variety of fish, clams, mollusks, shrimp, crab, and other items. By having all these products she hopes to have a larger  business, have a increase in her sales, have more customers, pay off debts and have more income available to spend on her family's expenses. 

She dreams of being in a better financial position, which will allow her to set up her own stand in the market in order to better serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fish, clams, mollusks, shrimp and crab.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.en:
Kathy decided to open Flower Basket and Gifts earlier this year after working in a floral and gift shop for over five years. Flower Basket and Gifts offers fresh and silk flowers, potted plants, fruit baskets, snack baskets, and candy arrangements.

This three-months-old business may still be in its infancy, but given Kathy’s passion for creating, it is showing a lot of promise. She has already provided floral arrangements for five weddings.

Unfortunately, Kathy’s floral cooler, which she uses to keep her flowers fresh, crisp, and vibrant, recently broke down, and she will use this loan to purchase a new one.

Help this engaged mother of two to purchase a new floral cooler so that she can continue to provide flowers for her customers’ special occasions and support her two sons.

loans.use: to purchase a new floral cooler

loans.name: Saoul

texts.en:
It was 2007, and Saoul, a former advertising freelancer, found himself in need of a job. Saoul noticed a niche in the publishing industry that had not yet been filled. It was then that he founded Heed Magazine, a publication that covers urban music, arts, and culture from a positive and in-depth perspective.

The D.C. native moved to NYC in 2008, and his publication has been on the move, too! Heed Magazine recently obtained acceptance as a newsstand publication via Barnes & Noble locations nationwide. 

This is where Saoul needs your help. This loan will help him fund the next issue for the national newsstand run in Barnes & Noble. This nationwide distribution will not only open up Heed Magazine to wider audience but also increase the potential for new partnerships and new advertising opportunities. Saoul also envisions further extensions of the Heed Magazine brand via an improved website, mobile apps, and the creation of an undiscovered talent concert series. 

Help Saoul spread his positive, clean-edged urban magazine to young adults across the country.

Check out Saoul’s business at http://heedmag.com

loans.use: To fund nationwide distribution of his magazine.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en: Maria dreams of becoming a sociologist but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Maria was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording her school. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Maria shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Maria plans to use her loan to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. With a degree in social sciences, she expects to earn $15 a day. Maria's parents were never able to complete their primary education. With six older siblings, Maria is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Zhen

texts.en:
Zhen came to the U.S. as an asylee with his parents when he was a teenager. His parents worked so hard to help him go to school, but because of their limited language skills, after college he had to start working to support the family. He started as a truck driver. However, as an entrepreneur, he always wanted to do some business by himself. Gradually, he started selling online clothes that he bought from China to the U.S. After several years in operation, he has already built a steady supply and has a steady income.
 
Now, because he is expecting a baby soon and because he has a dream of being a business owner, he decided to take the risk to open his own clothing store. With this store, he can be close to the family and realize his dream at the same time. A $6,000 KIVA loan will help him to build more inventories and complete the remolding of the store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and remodel his men's clothing retail store

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom, 35, lives with her husband and five children in a village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Two of her children are in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing watermelon for more than 10 years, and they supplement the family’s income by catching fish.

Rom has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six loan cycles and has paid back the loans completely. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood and keep her children in school. Now she is asking for another loan. Rom will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
Rem, 51, is married with six children and resides in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has been farming rice for 10 years and her husband also works to earn additional income to support the family. Together they earn about 32,000 KHR per day and save about 12,000 KHR each day for future needs.
 
Rem’s group consists of two members who are both female and have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Rem paid back the loan completely with VisionFund and successfully used the loan to better support her family. Now she is leading her group and asking for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labor to harvest rice. She hopes to grow more rice to increase her family’s income and to earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
Sokea, 34, is married with two children and resides in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two children. For the last ten years, she has been farming rice as the primary source of her family’s income. She earns about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sokea’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and they are with VisionFund for this cycle. Leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokea will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow more rice to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en:
Lina is aged 29 years and married with one son who is in school. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, earning a living through farming rice and growing pineapples. She can earn about 58,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] per day from the current business. 

This is Lina’s group loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she is a first-loan-cycle client with VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Lina will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rice and pineapple field. She hopes to make more rice and pineapple and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice and pineapple field

loans.name: Sarous' Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sarous is 41 years old and married with five children, two of whom are still in school. She earns a living through growing cassava and rubber trees, while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 90,000  KHR [Cambodian riels] per day from the current business, and can save about 40,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

This is the first loan for Sarous’s group of two members, and they both have just begun with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sarous is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her farmland and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Madalexny

texts.es: La señora Madalexny  tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Madalexny  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa según la temporada al por mayor  como pantalones y poleras ya que se acerca la época de calor y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Madalexny  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, su deseo es con el tiempo alquilar una tienda y poder vender variedad de ropa para distintas edades, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le dan el al otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Madalexny, 24, sells seasonal clothing in different markets in the city of Santa Cruz. This is her first loan with the institution, and she will use it to buy clothing in bulk like pants and polo shirts, since the hot season is coming and she needs to stock her business. Her reason for requesting a loan is so that she can increase her merchandise. Madalexny faces challenges in her business like competition from other vendors. She will use her profits to continue buying merchandise and thus generate more income. Her wish is to one day rent a store and be able to sell a variety of clothing for all ages. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her by this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing like pants and polo shirts.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, maíz, cebada, tarwi  y otras cosas más, ella de vez en cuando lleva y vende sus productos a las revendedoras de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene varios clientes que le compran desde hace varios años atrás pues sus productos son de buena calidad  entonces en esta oportunidad tiene un pedido pero requiere el préstamo para pagar a los peones que vas hacer la  cosecha. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Benita is a farmer and owns several pieces of land where she plants potatoes, corn, barley, lupin and other things. Every once in a while she takes her products and sells them to the resellers in different markets in the city of Cusco. She has several customers that have been buying from her for some years since her products are good quality. Right now she has an order to complete but needs the loan in order to pay the laborers who will harvest the crops. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to pay the workers who will harvest the crops.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Ana habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, madre soltera de un niño en edad escolares, ella labora como domestica para una casa privada y cuando puede vende ropa para obtener mayores ganancias, el credito lo solicita para comprar materiales de construccion como. hierro, zinc, perlines, cemento. ya que desea seguir mejorando su vivienda. agradece el apoyo y confianza que se le brindado al otorgarle este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother to a young son and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She works as a maid in a private home and also sells clothing on the side to generate additional income and provide for her son. 

With the support from this loan, Ana plans to purchase construction materials such as iron, zinc, cement, roofing slabs and other materials for making some much needed improvements to her house. She is very grateful for this opportunity to improve her house and give her son safer, more comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for making improvements to her house.

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, ha optado por otro crédito invertirá en la comprará pan dulce, pan para panes y tortas, variedad de bebidas, aderezos y otros ingredientes que necesita como materia prima para poder ofrecer sus productos a los clientes
Con el crédito anterior incremento sus ingresos con los cuales agrego otro tipo de actividad económica con la que ha ampliado su negocio, mejoro sus ventas y en gran medida ha cambiado el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Ángel has chosen to take out another loan that will be invested in the purchase of pastries, sandwich bread, dressings, a variety of beverages, and other ingredients that she needs to offer her products to customers. With the previous loan she increased her income which she used to add to her business, improve her sales and improve her family's lifestyle by a great measure.

loans.use: to buy pastries, sandwich bread, dressings, and a variety of beverages.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene 38 años nació en la comunidad de Rodeo de la provincia de Tiraque, actualmente vive junto a su familia en la misma comunidad, se dedica a la actividad agrícola y produce diferentes cultivos como papa, haba y flores, ahora solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono organico, semilla de papa, alimento para ganado y productos agroquimicos para la siembra de este año con el fin de obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Nelson is 38 years old and is from the community of Rodeo in the province of Tiraque. He currently lives with his family in Rodeo, and he makes a living as a farmer. Nelson grows and tends several crops, including potatoes, beans and flowers. 

With the support from this loan, Nelson plans to purchase farm supplies, such as organic manure, potato seed, cattle feed and agrochemical products for tending his crops. He hopes that this investment will help him to strengthen and expand his agricultural operation and generate greater profits and income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, such as: organic manure, potato seed, cattle feed and agrochemical products.

loans.name: Antonio Enrique

texts.es:
Don Antonio de 62 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado en el centro escolar, es el segundo de 14 hermanos,  él comenta que todos se dedicaron a trabajar en los cultivos de su casa junto a su padre. Se casó a la edad de 23 años y su esposa falleció hace 10 años, con ella procreo dos hijos, quienes ya son adultos y han formado sus propios hogares.

 Actualmente, don Antonio está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, en la casa solo vive él y su esposa, ya que sus hijos viven en otro departamento.

Don Antonio se dedica a trabajar como albañil, estudio esta profesión en su niñez cuando salió de sexto grado, se fue a la capital y se graduó como albañil en el año de 1969.  Él ha trabajado en distintas partes del país,  a lo largo de su vida aparte de este trabajo también se dedica a cultivar la tierra y cría de ganado y aves de corral, esto último lo realiza en conjunto con su compañera de vida.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para realizar un trámite para legalizar sus terrenos, ya que quiere repartir a sus hijos en partes iguales; pero necesita que todos los documentos estén en regla, de esta manera ellos podrán tomar parte de sus respectivos terrenos, sin ningún tipo de problema a futuro con otras personas.

En un futuro, don Antonio quiere tener todos sus bienes legales y sin problemas con los demás vecinos, quiere hacer más grande su casa para que cuando lo visiten sus nietos se sientan más cómodos de habitar en ella, esto lo lograra trabajando muy duro y teniendo la fe que sus sueños no son imposibles de cumplir.
texts.en:
Don Antonio is 62-years old.  He went to school through 6th grade and is the second of fourteen children.  He says that all of his siblings worked on the family farm with their father.  Don Antonio got married when he was 23-years old.  He wife passed away ten years ago.  They had two children together who are now grown and have their own families. 

Don Antonio re-married, and his current wife is a home-maker.  They live alone in their home, as don Antonio's children live in another department. 

Don Antonio makes his living as a brick-layer.  He studied the trade as a young boy.  When he finished the 6th grade, he went to the capital.  He graduated as a bricklayer in 1969.  Don Antonio has worked in different parts of the country over the course of his life.  He also earns a living cultivating the land and raising livestock and poultry, the later which he does in conjunction with his wife. 

The loan that don Antonio is requesting is to finalize some paperwork for his land.  He wants to give equal portions of his land to his children.  He needs to have all the documents in order so that they can each have their respective plots of land without future problems from others. 

In the future, don Antonio wants to have all his properties legalized and without any problems from his neighbors.  He wants to expand his house so that when his grandchildren come to visit, they can be more comfortable staying there.  He'll be able to do it through very hard work and having faith that it's not impossible for his dreams to come true.

loans.use: to take care of some legal paperwork for his land.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Ou Dong district, Lay is aged 51 years and married with four children. To make a living, she has been selling clothes and grocery items in the market nearby her home. Together, they have been in this business for 10 years. 

Lay is just beginning with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now, she is applying for an education loan to spend on the tuition fee for her son’s university studies with the faculty of Finance and Banking. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in university until his graduation.

loans.use: to spend on the university tuition fee for her son.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
A 44-year-old widow residing in a rural village of the Svay Reang province’s Svay Chrom district, Lean has three children to take care of and earns a living through farming rice and selling grocey items. Having been in this business for 29 years, she can earn about US$18 per day to make a living and can save about $5 each day for future needs. 

This is the first microloan for Lean with VisionFund. Now, she is applying for an education loan to pay for her daughter to study at university, specializing in finance and banking. This loan will enable her to send her daughter to university and to keep her there. Lean hopes that her daughter will have a good and bright future from this academic study and earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter to study at university

location.town: Svay Reang Province, Svay Chrom District

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan, 30, is a rural villager from the Tbaung Khmum district and earns a living by farming rice and selling grocery items. Having been in this business for more than 12 years, she is able to earn about 39,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Nan has been with VisionFund for two cycles, and she has paid back the past loans completely. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Nan will use her portion to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Vy is a 50-year-old mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. Rice farming and cabbage growing have been the sources of her family’s income to make a living for 32 years. The current business earns her about 29,000 KHR per day. 

Vy has been with VisionFund for six cycles and she completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group of four to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides, fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Nav

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in Kampong Speu province’s Phnom Srouch district, Nav is 44 and married with seven children, three of whom are still in school. For the last 20 years, she has been farming rice as the primary business for her family while her husband is a paid worker. The current business earns her about 9 USD per day to make a living, and she can save about 5 USD each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Nav with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to pay the tuition fee for her son’s university, where he is studying in the faculty of finance and banking. She hopes her son can obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son’s university.

location.town: Kompong Speu province, Phnom Srouch district

loans.name: Faitotoa

texts.en:
Faitotoa is 34 years old and married, with four children. 

She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for many years. Faitotoa has requested a loan to buy more vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and a garden hose. 

She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faitotoa will expand her business to the market.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and a garden hose

loans.name: G.s. Manos Unidas Group

texts.es:
El G.S Manos  Unidas está conformado por tres integrantes, madres, y padres responsables con cinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona  norte del país. EL sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de lácteos. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad lucha por brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos a través de los estudios. Que lamentablemente ellos no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.

Gracia a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del es  Jaqueline y tiene por actividad la venta de artesanía de forma ambulante como adornos elaborados de barro, como jarrones, casitas de barro, jugos de cocina, ollas, al cancillas, tinajas, adornos colgantes, campanas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de artesanía, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El g.s  Manos Unidas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Manos Unidas" (United Hands) is made up of three members.  They are responsible mothers and fathers with five children in their care.  They are natives of Sauce, which is located in the country's northern zone.  EL Sauce is known for being a dairy-producing zone.  The members of this communal bank are known for being hard-working and responsible with great desires to better their situations.  They are currently working hard to offer their young children a better future through education, which they, unfortunately, weren't able to have due to a lack of financial resources. 

The coordinator of the bank is Jaqueline, and her business is selling handicrafts as a street vendor.  She sells clay decorations, clay cottages, kitchen sets, money boxes, clay jars, hanging decorations and bells.  She works about ten hours a day selling her products.  Her objective with the loan is to invest in working capital- buying and selling handicrafts- so that in the near future she can earn a better income.  The communal bank "Manos Unidas" is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders are offering to low-income people in poor countries, like Nicaragua, so they can earn a dignified living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up her handicraft business by purchasing vases, clay cottages, kitchen sets, pots, money boxes, clay jars, hanging decorations and bells.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria continua dedicándose a la artesanía y sigue teniendo un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas y otras cosas más pero también se dedica a la fabricación de telares, ella se siente contenta por participar en este proyecto y desea continuar en el banco comunal y requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como lana de alpaca y oveja.
texts.en:
Maria continues her craft and weaving business from her small workshop located in her home. She makes and sells an assortment of hand-woven products, including scarves, sweaters, etc., and she also makes looms. 

Maria is very happy to be a member of the community bank, and she plans to use the support from this loan to purchase materials for use in her weaving, including alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.use: to purchase materials for use in her weaving, such as alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.name: Peri

texts.en:
Pəri is 54 years old. For over 20 years, her family has been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land in Fuzuli city. They now live in a hostel that is located in the Absheron region. Three years ago her husband died, so she is a widow. After this accident, Peri was to provide for her family. Her elder daughter is married, one of her sons is in his fourth year of studies at a university, and her youngest son is in his second year of studies at college.

Peri produces the national tendir bread and sells it in order to live on and provide for her family. “Tendir” is an Azerbaijan oven for baking that is made of clay in a hole in the earth. Peri's tendir was damaged and its workability was reduced. Today, Pəri wants to develop her business and increase her monthly income. Therefore, she needs 2,250 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair her tendir. Peri hopes that after repairing it, her monthly income will be better and her business will increase.

She is thankful for the aid of Komak and Kiva organizations. In the future she wants to build a big tendir house.

loans.use: to repair her tendir.

loans.name: Leone

texts.en:
Leone is 24 years old and lives with her partner and three children. 

She runs a small business selling fish, etc., in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Leone has requested a loan to buy new fishing gear, goggles, and bait. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leone will support her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy goggles, fishing gear, and bait

loans.name: Vaituutuu

texts.en:
Vaituutuu is 24 years old and married, with one child. 

She runs a small business selling bananas, taamu, etc., in her community and has been doing this for four years. 

Vaituutuu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a grass sprayer, fertilizer, bush knives, and a crowbar. 

She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vaituutuu will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a grass sprayer, fertilizer, bush knives, and a crowbar

loans.name: Luana

texts.en: Luana is a 36 year old woman who is partnered with 1 child. She has a small taxi service business. She has 5 years experience with this business. Luana needs a loan to buy new tyre, vehicle registration, vehicle shocks and brake pads. She will use her profits to expand her business and improve her family standard of living. Luana joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tyre, vehicle registration, vehicle shocks and brake pads

loans.name: Lees

texts.en: Lees is 32 years old and single with 1 child. She runs a small business selling banana, taamu etc in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. Lees has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, backpack sprayer, bush knives, and pickaxe. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lees will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, backpack sprayer, bush knives, and pickaxe

loans.name: Cristhian Francela

texts.es: Cristhian es una joven originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega, casada y madre de un hijo. Tiene 27 años de edad. Ella es estudiante de la carrera Ingeniería en Sistema, la cual con mucha entrega y disciplina ha logrado salir adelante con sus estudios. Es una joven muy apasionada en lo que hace, lo que le va a permitir obtener un buen futuro profesional en el cargo en que llegue a  desempeñar. Sus padres la apoyan en todo momento, al igual que su esposo, que la ayuda económicamente. Solicita un crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, con el fin de obtener su título universitario y poder desempeñarse en el campo laboral. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá culminar su carrera y ser una profesional con éxito.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a young woman from the city of Chinandega. She is 27, married, and the mother of a son. 

She is a student, studying for a degree in systems engineering, and with much dedication and discipline she has managed to succeed in her studies.

She is a young woman who is very excited about what she is doing, which will allow her to have a good future as a professional, in the position she eventually holds.

Her parents support her at all times, as does her husband, who helps her financially.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her degree graduation course, with the aim of obtaining her university diploma and being able to join the workforce. She considers that the loan will be beneficial as she will be able to complete her degree and be a successful professional.

loans.use: To pay for her degree graduation course.

loans.name: Yalaniz Yaoska

texts.es: Yalaniz tiene 17 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es una pequeña joven con deseos de superación. Estudiante de secundaria y técnico medio en contabilidad. Su sueño es bachillerarse y estudiar la carrera de Derecho, la cual le apasionan las leyes y la justicia. Sus padres y hermanos la apoyan en lo que hace. Su meta es obtener buenas notas y buenos conocimientos durante la enseñanza de su carrera.  Solicita el crédito para pagar los gastos de su promoción de secundaria, con el fin de obtener el título de bachiller en ciencias y letras. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá culminar sus estudios y asumir los gastos de su promoción. Su plan futuro es culminar su carrera y  obtener el título de Licenciatura en Derecho.
texts.en:
Yalaniz, 17, is from the city of Managua. She is a young lady with a desire to improve herself. She is a high school student working towards an associate's degree in accounting. Her dream is to graduate and study law. She is passionate about the law and justice. Her parents and siblings support her in what she does. Her goal is to get good grades and learn a lot during her training.

She asks for a loan to pay for the cost of her high school studies, with the goal of graduating with a degree in science and arts. She believes that the loan will be of great help because she will be able to finish her studies and take responsibility for the costs of her schooling. Her plan for the future is to finish her professional studies and get a law degree.

loans.use: to pay for her high school education.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 38 years old and a  widow.  She lives in the village of Ninotsminda near the capital city with her daughter and brother. 

The only one who earns money in the household is Shorena’s brother, who works on house renovations, but even his income is not stable as he is dependent on special projects. The family lives in poverty, so Shorena’s decided to start her own business and generate income.

Shorena has requested a loan to hire a stall at the capital city open market and to purchase a coffee grinder. She will sell coffee and offer grinding services to her clients. 

Shorena plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. This will raise the income of the family, which she will use to improve the family’s living conditions and finance the education of her child. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to hire a stall at the open market and buy a coffee grinder

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech, 45, is from a rural village located in the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu province. She is married with six children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting various kinds of vegetables. The current business earns her about 7 USD per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Pech just joined VIsionFund this cycle. She is asking for a loan to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who is in university. She hopes this loan will enable her daughter to study in university.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter in university.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Claudio Ricardo

texts.en:
Claudio is a hog farmer in an urban zone. This makes him very unpopular with his neighbors; the smells and flies emanating from his sty are unpleasant, to say the least. However, Claudio and his family have been farming in the same location for generations and would like to continue doing so.

With his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to effectively treat the pig waste, reducing flies and odors but also earning him two resources: methane-rich, renewable biogas and organic biofertilizer. In addition to increasing harmony with his neighbors, the digester will save him money on energy and fertilizer, displacing propane and agrochemical fertilizer. 

This loan represents 47% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Afig

texts.en:
Afig is married, 28 years old, and has three children. His elder daughter is in third grade, and his little daughter and son go to kindergarten. Ceyran is Afig’s wife, and she is a housewife. Afig’s family have been IDP (Internally Displacted Persons) from Agdam city for already 20 years, and now they live in the Mehdiabad settlement of Absheron region.

Afig is a taxi driver, and he transports passengers between different areas of the Absheron region. Now Afig wants to repair his taxi. He wants to buy a new motor for his car and increase his monthly income. For this reason he applied for a loan amount of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).

He is thankful for the help from Komak and Kiva organizations. In the future he wants to paint his car.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Keki

texts.en: Keki is a 31 year old married woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation that grows taro, taamu, yams and ava to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Keki has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush-knives, weedkiller, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Keki hopes to improve her business to gain more money to support her family and her kid as well.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush-knives, weedkiller, axes, and rakes.

loans.name: Taliai

texts.en: Taliai is 35 years old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbages, beans, cucumbers, and pumpkin that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Taliai needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Taliai will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation, support her family and her kid's education as well.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes.

loans.name: Faanefu

texts.en: Faanefu is a 28 years old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana, yams, to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Faanefu has requested a loan to buy wheelbarrow, spade, bush knives, chemicals and a bag of fertilizer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Faanefu hopes to extend her business and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, spade, bush knives, chemicals, and a bag of fertilizer

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia, tiene  63 años, es viuda, vive junto a sus dos hijas y un yerno, debido  a la necesidad de generar más ingresos para apoyar con los gastos de su casa inicio por su cuenta un negocio que consiste en la venta de ropa casa por casa, tiene un año realizando está actividad.
Con el préstamo comprara blusas, gorras, camisas y ropa interior. Espera poder tener su negocio muy surtido para estas fiestas navideñas pues las ventas aumentan y puede tener mejores ingresos con los que podrá cancelar la deuda y apoyando con los gastos de su casa.
Su sueño es tener un puesto en el mercado municipal de su localidad para evitar andar trasladando la mercadería cuando sale a vender casa por casa.
texts.en:
Amelia is 63-years old.  She is a widow and lives with her two daughters and a son-in-law.  Because she needed to generate an income to help with the household expenses, she started a business on her own.  She sells clothing door-to-door and has been doing so for one year. 
With the loan, Amelia will purchase blouses, hats, shirts and undergarments.  She hopes to be able to stock up her business well for the Christmas season.  Sales go up during that time, and she could have a greater income, with which she would be able to pay-off her loan and help with the household expenses. 
Amelia's dream is to have a stall in the municipal market where she lives.  Then she wouldn't have to keep moving her merchandise, as she does when she sells door-to-door.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, hats, shirts and under-garments.

loans.name: David Omar

texts.es:
David, solicita capital nuevamente por que ve en el uso de créditos una herramienta muy útil para ampliar con rapidez su negocio, con el préstamo comprara una consola de juegos, para seguir innovando sus servicios. 
Con la inversión anterior tuvo mucho más clientes satisfechos, un negocio muy equipado, tiene una economía más estable y cancelo con puntualidad sus cuotas. También está impartiendo capacitaciones a jóvenes sobre como reparar consolas y videojuegos.
texts.en:
David is requesting capital again because he sees the loans as a very useful tool for quickly expanding his business.  With this loan, he will purchase a game counsel to keep updating his services. 
With the previous loan, David earned a lot more satisfied customers, a well-equipped business and more stable finances, and he punctually paid back his loan.  David is also offering classes to young people on repairing counsels and video games.

loans.use: to purchase a game counsel.

loans.name: Los Angeles Del Floron 7  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Florón  en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Los Ángeles del Florón 7. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, agricultura,  prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Para ellas este es el primer crédito con el cual esperan impulsar sus actividades y así mejorar su calidad de vida para el bienestar de sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Flor, tiene 48 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 24, 19, 18 y 17  años, el menor  estudia en colegio, 3 de ellos viven en su casa. Su marido trabaja eventualmente.
Doña Flor es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ganar sus propios recursos y con esto sacar adelante a su familia ya que su marido no gana lo suficiente cuando  trabaja, ella trabaja en un comedor cuatro días ganando un sueldo semanal, pero su jefa le da el local para que ella por su cuenta venda comida los tres días restantes de la semana y sus ganancias sean para ella, allí prepara desayunos y almuerzos, ya son 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos que ella vende. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la rapidez con que le llego el crédito. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos sean personas de bien y profesionales.
texts.en:
In an area known as El Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the lending group Los Ángeles del Florón 7 meet every 15 days. They have various businesses like general commerce, agriculture, service provision and other things. This is their first loan, which they hope to use to propel their businesses forward and thus improve their quality of life, for the wellbeing of their families.

One of the members of the group is Flor, 48, who is married and has four children ages 24, 19, 18 and 17. The youngest is in high school, and three of them still live at home. Her husband works occasionally. Flor is a determined woman who likes to work to earn her own money and use that to support her family since her husband doesn't earn enough when he works. She works in a restaurant 4 days a week, earning a weekly salary, but her boss gives her the space to use to sell her own food on the other three days of the week, keeping the profits. She cooks breakfasts and lunches there. She has been doing this for 10 years in order to support her family.

This loan is to buy the provisions necessary to make the meals that she sells. This is her first cycle with the lending group and she likes it because her loan arrived quickly. Her dream for her children to be good people and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a software license.

loans.name: Freys Orlando

texts.es:
Freys es un hombre muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de ropa con el cual actualmente tiene ingresos para poder salir adelante desde hace 10 años.

Freys está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva y que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como polos short, ropa interior, entre otros y poder mejorar sus ingresos y tener más productos para atender a sus clientes, de esta manera seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en: Freys is a hardworking man, who with a lot of effort started a business 10 years ago selling clothing, which currently provides him with income to get ahead. Freys is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he will be able to buy more merchandise for his business like polo shirts, underwear and other things, which will improve his income and the inventory that he has to offer his customers. This way he can keep fighting to get ahead and realize his dream of owning a home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es: Carolina es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de cuatro hijos. De 39 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de nacatamal, helados y frescos naturales. Este negocio lo inicio incentivada por su mama, quien empezó la idea de tener una venta de nacatamales, con el paso del tiempo dejo que su hija continuara con este negocio. Actualmente doña Carolina administra las ventas de nacatamales, además ofrece bebidas naturales y helados, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante. Su meta próxima es seguir trabajando hasta construir una pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar: papas, tomate, maíz, arroz, carne de cerdo, frutas, entre otros, con el fin de adquirir lo necesario para elaboración de sus nacatamales y frescos, así ofrecerles a sus clientes. Estima que este crédito será beneficioso ya que crecerá su negocio con la elaboración de más nacatamales y de frescos, aumentando sus ganancias. Su plan futuro es poner su pulpería.
texts.en: Carolina is originally from the city of Granada. She is married with 4 children. She is 39 years old. She is in the merchant trade and sells tamales, ice cream and natural drinks for a living. She began this business incentivized by her mother, who started the idea of selling tamales, with the passage of time letting her daughter take over the business. Today Carolina oversees the sale of tamales. She also offers natural drinks and ice cream, which has allowed her to move forward. Her next goal is to continue working on the construction of a grocery shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase potatoes, tomato, corn, rice, pork, fruit, etc, with the end of acquiring what is necessary to make her tamales and drinks, to offer to her customers. She estimates that this credit will be beneficial as she will grow her business with the making of more tamales and drinks, growing her income. Her future plan is to open her grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomato, corn, rice, pork, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y está contenta porque pudo aumentar  el capital del negocio y desea continuar participando en este proyecto,ella nos cuenta que el crédito lo utilizo para comprar semillas y abonos y le fue muy bien. Ahora, ella continua participando en el banco comunal y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes.
texts.en: Martina is grateful to all the investors for the loan and is happy because she was able to grow the capital of her business and wants to continue participating in this project. She tells us that she utilized the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer and it went very well. Now she continues participating in community bank and this opportunity requires a loan in order to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: G.s. Hermanos De Nagarote Group

texts.es:
El g.s. Hermanos de Nagarote está conformado por tres integrantes, dos mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres de familias responsables con hijos menores bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Y se caracteriza por su comida típica como el quesillo y el tiste. Son personas, responsables, trabajadoras, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad luchan para  proporcionarles mejores oportunidades a su hijos, lograr sus sueños más anhelados como es formarlos en vida  espiritual, moral, e intelectual. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Mariela y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva variada como pantalones, short, faldas, blusas, ropa interior, ropa de niño, camisolines, medias, pijamas, quimones, pantaletas, ropa de cama, toallas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y  surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s. Hermanos de Nagarote agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The lending group Hermanos de Nagarote is made up of three members, two women and one man, mothers and fathers responsible for young children. They are from Nagarote, located in the western part of the country, an area known for typical food like quesillo cheese and hot chocolate. They are responsible and hardworking people with a desire to get ahead. Unfortunately none of them were able to study because they didn't have the money. Now they are fighting to give their children better opportunities and to realize their dreams by preparing them for life spiritually, morally and intellectually.

Mariela is the coordinator, thanks to her hard work. She sells new clothing like pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, underwear, children's clothing, dickeys, socks, pajamas, kimonos, panties, bed sheets and towels. She works 8 hours a day at her business. The goal of this loan is to invest in business capital and stock her store so that in the near future she can earn more profits. The lending group Hermanos de Nagarote thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can make more money.

loans.use: to invest in business capital and stock their store with merchandise like pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, underwear, children's clothing, dickeys, socks, pajamas, kimonos, panties, bed sheets, towels.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, se decidió por otro crédito, en esta ocasión comprara repollos, güisquiles, guineos, melones, pepinos, zanahorias, etc. espera que con su inventario surtido tener un negocio que responda con las necesidades de sus clientes
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo más ganancias, aumento sus ventas y cancelo puntualmente sus cuotas, su ventaja es que su negocio es el único que ofrece está clase de productos en el lugar donde vive.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio para tener una economía mucho más estable que le dé la oportunidad de seguir cubriendo los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Emilia decided on another loan. This time she will buy cabbage, pear squash, bananas, melons, cucumbers, carrots, etc. With her stocked inventory she expects to have a business that responds to the needs of her customers.
With the previous loan she had much success. She grew her sales and punctually made her payments. Her advantage is that her business is the only one that offers this class of products in the place where she lives.
She dreams of growing her business to have a much more stable economy that gives her the opportunity to continue covering the expenses of the household.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage, pear squash, bananas, melons, cucumbers, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Geovana Del Socorro

texts.es: Giovanna tiene 37 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Casada y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de refresco y vigoron. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, con idea de sentirse una mujer útil, y tener sus propios ingresos. Empezó vendiendo frescos, poco a poco, realizo la venta de vigoron. Actualmente consta con la venta de ambos, lo cual le ha generado buenas ganancias. Su meta próxima es aumentar su negocio para obtener más ganancias y ahorrarlas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: yuca al por mayor, chicharrón, repollo, frutas, entre otros, con el fin de adquirir los ingredientes necesarios para el vigoron y de los refrescos. Estima que este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara su producción y aumentara las ventas. Su plan futuro es ahorrar para construir una pulpería.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 37 years old, and comes from the city of Granada. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a vendor by trade, and sells fruit drinks and vigorón (traditional Nicaraguan dish consisting of a cabbage salad, boiled yuca, and fried pork wrapped in a banana leaf). She started this business a few years ago, with the idea of feeling useful and having her own income. 

She started selling fruit drinks and gradually started selling the vigorón.  Now she sells both, which has generated good earnings. Her immediate goal is to increase her business so that she can obtain more earnings and save.  

She is requesting the loan to buy: yuca at wholesale, pork, cabbage, fruit, and other items, with the aim of acquiring the necessary ingredients for the vigorón and fruit drinks. She considers that the loan will be a great help to her, as she will increase her production and sales. Her future plan is to save, in order to set up a small general store.

loans.use: To buy yuca at wholesale, pork, cabbage, fruit, and other items.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Las Mercedes es un grupo que se acaba de formar, está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, además de eso forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están muy activamente.
Mirtha es una de estas mujeres, quien por medio de la costura está tratando de ir mejorando su economía y ayudar a su familia. Es una costurera muy buena y siempre esta con mucho trabajo, ya que sus clientes siempre están conformes, es conocida en el barrio por ser una persona servicial y amable. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, y así seguir con sus confecciones y cumpliendo también con su clientela.
texts.en:
Las Mercedes is a group that just formed. It is in its first cycle in the Women's Committee program. In addition, they are also part of the Poverty Elimination Program, in which they are all active members. 

Mirtha is one of these women, who with her sewing business is trying to go on improving her finances and help her family. She is a very good seamstress and she always has a lot of work since she already has a good customer base. She is known in her neighborhood for being a helpful and friendly person. Mirtha is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of fabrics and threads. In this way she will continue making clothing as well as doing jobs for her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Loto

texts.en: Loto is a 35-year-old widow with three children. She has a small plantation that grows taro, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Loto has requested a loan to buy chemicals, spades, a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, weed-sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Loto hopes to improve her business to gain more money, support her family and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, spades, a wheelbarrow, a chainsaw, weed-sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Cochapamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Cochapamba está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia se encuentra rodeada de mucha vegetación y verdes campos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente se caracteriza por ser amable y gentil que luchan día a día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares, ya que su objetivo principal es entregarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y poder brindarles mejores oportunidades, son mujeres que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Julia, tiene 44 años de edad, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 23, 21, 20 y 13 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Julia es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a lavar ropa ajena desde hace algunos años, también en los días de feria se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, en su casa cría animales como cuyes y cerdos y la cosecha que obtiene de la agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, cerdos y frutas. Su meta es ampliar su negocio de animales.
texts.en:
The lending group Cochapamba is made up of 8 women who live on the outskirts of the Valle parish in Cuenca. This parish is surrounded by vegetation and green fields; the architecture is a mix of the antique and the modern. The people are known for being friendly and gentle, and they work day to day to improve the financial situation of their homes, with their main goal being to give their children a better future with more opportunities. The women still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of the group is Julia, 44, a widow and mother of four children ages 23, 21, 20 and 13. The oldest three children work and help her out financially, and the youngest is in high school in the city. Julia is a hardworking woman, washing other people's clothing. On market days she also sells seasonal fruit, and at home she raises animals like guinea pigs and pigs. She farms for their use at home. The money from the loan will be used to buy guinea pigs, pigs and fruits. Her goal is to increase her animal husbandry business.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs and fruits.

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.es:
Bismarck tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su menor hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, yuca, maíz, algodón a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores pavos, patos, gallinas, son muy conocidos en la zona dedicándose desde hace 10 años a esta actividad.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de , 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos en las comunidades aledañas y de esta manera generarle mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Bismarck is 35 years old. He lives together with his wife and his young son in the district of Oyotún. Its population cultivates rice, yucca, corn and cotton for a living. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

With the help of his spouse, they raise and sell small animals like turkeys, ducks and chickens for a living. They are well known in the area, having worked for 10 years in this trade.

He is requesting a loan of 1200 nuevos soles, or $450, for the purchase of small animals to then fatten and offer to the surrounding communities and in this way generate better income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase small animals to raise.

loans.name: Demy

texts.en:
Demy is 26 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Demy requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Demy has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Demy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia is a 33-year-old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells snacks and ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Litia needs a loan to buy noodles, snacks, foam cups, sack of sugar, cordial, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Litia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy noodles, snacks, foam cups, sack of sugar, cordial, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items like canned goods, eggs, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items like canned goods, eggs, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 60 years old and widowed. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 11 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Leonora requested a loan of 22,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.  She has previously borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Norma es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma prepara, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que a sus comidas son muy solicitadas y les gusta a sus clientes. Quiere seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante para ayudar a su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus alimentos, como harina, huevo, jamón, queso, etc. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de crecer y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Concepción which is in the zone closely located to the central zone and is still growing. It is an area that is difficult to access, so the members of this group want to grow and strive to give the area where they live a better environment as they grow slowly.
Norma is one of the members. She sells food she prepares herself for a living and says that it is going very well, as her food is in high demand and liked by her customers. She wants to continue working and moving forward to help her family.
She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies to continue making her food, such as flour, egg, ham, cheese etc. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to grow and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, egg, ham, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su tercer ciclo, ellas son mujeres de familia, que se unieron con el objetivo de poder ayudar a sus hijos y poder darles todo lo que no pudieron tener. Están formando parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de ayuda para todas.
Maria es parte de este desafío, ella vende prendas variadas, y este es su medio de procurarse los ingresos que necesita para seguir mejorando su economía y así tratar de salir de la pobreza. Vio una gran oportunidad de crecimiento dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, también ayudada por las capacitaciones.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser remeras, shorts, camisillas y demás, ya que se acerca el verano y quiere poder tener una buena variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is in its third loan cycle. They are family women who came together with the goal of being able to help their children and give them everything that they could not have themselves. They form part of the poverty elimination program as a means of helping everyone.

Maria is part of this challenge. She sells various garments, and this is her way of getting the income that she needs to continue improving her finances and therefore trying to rise above poverty. She saw a great growth opportunity within the poverty elimination program, and she also gets help from the trainings.

Now, she is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of various garments, such as t-shirts, shorts, shirts and others, as summer is coming and she wants to be able to have a good variety for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, shorts, shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lourdes is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell at her general store.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Cayetana requested a loan of 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional equipment and gears for her fishing business.
