In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and gears for her fishing business.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Rosana has a bakery business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, and butter for her business.

Rosana has been in the bakery business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, and butter for her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 34 years old, is married, and has four children. Three of her children are still in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock. She has been raising livestock for 3 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Sinfrosa

texts.en:
Sinfrosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

Sinfrosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mohamed Mahdi

texts.en: Mohamed Mahdi is 20 years old. He studies at Gollis University, in the Faculty of Telecommunication Engineering. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. Buying a laptop on his own is the biggest challenge he has faced in his learning process. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students a soft copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide, which he will pay for in monthly installments. In the future, Mohamed hopes to prepare for a masters degree and work as a telecommunication engineer.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Ray

texts.en: Ray is a 48 year old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbage, beans, cucumbers and pumpkins that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Ray needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Ray will use the profits from her sales to improve her business, support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc

loans.name: Nicima Mohamed

texts.en: Nicima Mohamed is 22 years old. She studies at New Generation University College, in the Human Resource Management program. Her main challenge is lack of a laptop. Nicima Mohamed needs a laptop to prepare her assignments and read lessons given in soft copy (i.e., in electronic form) as lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students a soft copy of the lessons. She cannot pay all the money for the laptop at once. She approached Kaaba MFI, which will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Abdilahi Khalif

texts.en: Abdilahi  Khalif is 21 years old. He studies at Gollis University, in the faculty of Civil Engineering.  He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. Buying a laptop on his own is the most challenge he has faced in his learning process. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students the soft copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide, which he will pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
As a married Mother of eight children, Valerie works hard to support her family.

She has a chainsaw rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Valerie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Valerie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Mijahd Group

texts.en: Mijahd is a five-member group. All of them are poor ladies from Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a 250,000 YER loan from AMB . Jamila is a 34-year-old married woman who has some children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and living in a poor area in Sana`a. Her house is very old and in miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house but now she needs more money. She needs to complete the renovation, so she asked for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to use for renovating her house.

loans.name: Fasialofa

texts.en: Fasialofa is a 48 year old widowed woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 4 years.  Fasialofa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, weed killer, axes, a wheelbarrow and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010 . With her profits, Fasialofa hopes to improve her business to gain more money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, knives, weed  killer, axes, a wheelbarrow and rakes.

loans.name: Asma Mahamoud

texts.en: Asma Mahamoud is 20 years old. She studies Information Communication Technology at Admas University College and is a senior. Her problem is that she has no laptop, so it’s difficult for her to have practical practice and to prepare her research paper for graduation. She has been informed of Kaaba-Kiva's laptop loans and would like to obtain a laptop through a loan. She approached Kaaba MFI, which will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Om-Ibrahim Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Ibrahim and consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. The ladies are helpful members who have known each other for many years. They have applied for a loan of 160,000 Yemeni rials (YER).

Aziah, one of the members, is 43 years old and the mother of eight children. She is the breadwinner who works to earn household expenses for her family. She lives with her family in a small house in Sana'a, in bad conditions, and she would like to buy construction supplies, but she suffers from a lack of money, so she is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER in order to buy construction materials such as cement and bricks to remodel her home. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement and bricks to remodel her home

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
El señor Braulio tiene 62  años de edad, es zapatero de profesión, su esposa es la señora María de 66 años, el matrimonio tiene un hijo varón, por quien esta pareja siempre ha luchado para hacer de su hijo una persona de bien.
Se inició en su oficio hace más de 20 años, tenía zapatería propia, luego con el pasar  de los años por el ingreso de calzados extranjeros dejo de lado y tuvo un comercio, le fue bastante bien y llego a comprar una propiedad en donde habilitó también un lavadero. Luego volvió a su trabajo de zapatero que hoy en día también hace. Es una persona muy trabajadora que pese a todo quiere seguir trabajando y mejorando.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cuerinas varias e insumos para el lavadero que tiene. Está contento por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Braulio, 62, is a shoemaker.  He is married to Maria, 66.  Together they have a son, who they have worked hard to raise as a respectable person. 

He started his business more than 20 years ago with his own shoe shop, but as the years passed and foreign shoes started to come onto the market, he set it aside to set up another small business.  He was quite successful and was able to buy a property where he also set up a laundry.  Since then, he has gone back to his job as a shoemaker which he still does today.  He is a very hard-working person who in spite of any difficulties, wants to continue working and improving.

He is asking for this loan to buy imitation leather and supplies for his laundry.  He appreciates the help that he is getting.

loans.use: to buy imitiation leather and supplies for a laundry.

loans.name: Dina Argelia

texts.es:
Dina, se decidió por otro crédito por que ve en ellos una herramienta que le facilita surtir su inventario de una manera rápida, con el crédito comprara hierro, clavos, machetes, y accesorios para para electricidad, los cuales ofrecerá a sus clientes. Con el préstamo anterior ella aumento los artículos que vende, aumento sus ganancias, sus ingresos aumentaron dándole la oportunidad de cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
Dina ha mejorado en gran medida su situación economía y la está aprovechando junto a su hijo que es quien la apoya en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dina has decided to ask for another credit because it is a useful way to get supplies quickly.  With this loan she will buy iron, nails, machetes and electrical supplies to offer to her customers.  With the last loan she increased the amount of products she sells and started to make more profit.  This helped her to pay off her loan on time.

Dina has improved her financial situation significantly and together with her son, who helps her in the business, they are benefitting from it.

loans.use: to buy iron, nails, machetes, and electrical supplies.

loans.name: Timoteo Aparicio

texts.es:
Timoteo, está preparando todo para su siembra y necesita comprar abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas, esto le ayudara a preparar la tierra y tener una cosecha abundante.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo los insumos agrícolas necesarios para obtener una cosecha abundante, cumplió con las exigencias de sus clientes,  mejoro sus ventas, los nuevos ingresos que obtuvo le han permitido apoyar incondicionalmente a su familia.
texts.en:
Timoteo is preparing to sow seeds and he needs to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides and insecticides which will help him to prepare the soil to have a plentiful harvest.

With his last loan he had the agricultural supplies necessary to get a good harvest and satisfy his customers’ needs.  He improved his sales and with the income he earned, he has been able to provide support for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
Inas is a 26-year-old married woman from a small village near Tulkarem city. She is a mother for five sons and three daughters. For the past five years, Inas and her husband have been working as farmers on their land. They have olive trees and other seasonal crops. It is a good business and earns a good income but it is seasonal. 
Inas took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to renew the irrigation system for the family farm. This will improve the farm conditions and the crops will be better.

loans.use: to renew the irrigation system for the family farm.

loans.name: Enalda

texts.pt:
Enalda  tem 36  anos de idade, solteira e mãe  de 02 filhos menores . a sua base de sustento é o negócio ela trabalha todos os dias vendendo  lençõis diversos e cortinas por entrega nas empresas e casas. Todos os meses viaja para paises vizinhos comprar sua mercadoria.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  lençois e cortinas para revender .
O seu maior sonho é de construir uma loja para fazer seu negócio num local fixo.
 Seu desafio é de pagar o seu empréstimo dentro do periodo pré-estabelecido  e procurar novos clientes.
texts.en:
Enalda is 36 years old, single and the mother of 2 children who are both underage. Her livelihood is her business and she works every day selling bedsheets and curtains by delivering them to companies and homes. Every month she travels to neighbouring countries to buy her goods.

With this loan she plans to buy bedsheets and curtains for resale.

Her biggest dream is to build a shop and run her business from a fixed location.
Her challenge is to pay off her loan within the pre-agreed term and to find new customers.

loans.use: buy bedsheets and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Afrah Group

texts.en: This group is called Afrah. It is made up of four women, from Hodeida, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 80,000 YER. Afrah is the group's leader. She is 30 years old, a single woman. She has had a business selling new clothes, perfumes and incense for one year. One of Afrah's goals is to continue to grow her business. Since she has professional experience in this field, she attracted more customers, which helped her family to continue successfully running and making the business more profitable. She is using her share of the loan to invest in her business, by buying more clothes, perfumes and incense to resell to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue. She hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, perfumes and incense to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Haidar Group

texts.en: Haidar group consists of four women from Al-Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER to purchase ice cream for resale. Nadhra, a 38-year-old married woman from Al-Hodeidah, is the leader of the group. She is the mother of five children and the breadwinner of the family. Four years ago, she started up her business in selling ice cream to assist her husband in covering household expenses. She had no choice but to work and provide her family with food and clothing. She managed to succeed in the first business of her entire life. Al-Hodeidah Governorate is one of the warmest cities in Yemen and therefore most of the residents buy ice cream daily. Nadhra wants to start selling ice cream in new quarters and places in her city, and this is why she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER. She looks forward to improving her family's living conditions and buying a new fridge.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Mohammad's father works as an employee in the public sector. Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies finance. He loves this specialization and he would like to work in a financial institution when we graduates. 
Mohammad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and reports easily. 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Raneen

texts.en:
Raneen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
Raneen is a 21-year-old married woman from Tulkarem city. She lives with her husband in a simple house in the city. Raneen and her husband would like to open their own project, which is a mini-market. It is a good business and there is no such store in the area. 
Raneen took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to open a new mini-market by buying more products and installing shelves By applying for this loan, Raneen and her husband will be able to have their own business and their living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to help her and her husband open a new mini-market by buying more products and installing shelves.

loans.name: Luisa Janely

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Leónidas Proaño se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Aquí vive la señora Luisa, tiene 38 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una  hija de 14 años que estudia en colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres con su hija. 
Doña Luisa es una muy buena madre  que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sacar adelante a su hija se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatillas de damas. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día,  la mayor parte de sus ventas son por pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 15 días. Ella viaja a quito o  Ambato a comprar sus mercadería. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto está sacando adelante sola a su hija. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.  Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The 'Leónidas Proaño' loan group gets together every fortnight in the neighborhood of the same name in the city of Manta, a city known for it's gorgeous beaches which are visited by many people all year round as it is a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.
Here lives Ms Luisa who is 38 years old and a single mother to a 14 year old daughter who goes to school. She lives in her parents' house with her daughter.

Ms Luisa is a good mother who, in order to make her own living and to make sure her daughter gets ahead, sells clothes and women's shoes. She sells door-to-door, working three days a week for around two to three hours a day and the majority of her sales are through advanced orders from her customers. She delivers her products to them on credit and only charges them every 15 days. She travels to Quito or to Ambato to buy her goods. She has been doing this for 4 years and thanks to her business, her daughter is able to get ahead.

This loan is to buy all types of clothes and shoes. She has been with the loan group for 4 years and she likes it as thanks to her first loan she was able to start her business. Her dreams are to provide the best of everything for her daughter.

loans.use: buy all types of clothes and shoes
